loans.use: to purchase more clothes, shoes, and bags in order to increase her sales.

loans.name: Vester

texts.en: Vesta is married and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. She is a Learner Guide working with schools in her community to improve young people’s well-being. She also has been running a successful business selling broiler chickens to feed her community. A Kiva loan will help her expand her operation by buying more chicks to raise. The loan will pay for the chicks, as well as the feed and supplies required to raise them to six weeks before being sold. Growing her business and increasing her income will help provide for her family and assist those in need across her community.

loans.use: to expand her operation by buying more chicks to raise.

loans.name: Placidia

texts.en: Placidia is 27 years old, married with two children and living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumni network and volunteers her spare time assisting girls at the nearest secondary school with guidance and counseling as well as sourcing food for needy children within her community. Placidia has been running a stall at the local flea market selling clothing to support her family. She has, on her own, been running her business for a year now and would love to see it expand. With the requested Kiva loan, she will purchase larger amounts of quality and affordable clothing to attract more customers and increase sales. With additional profits she plans to open a clothing shop and create employment for people within her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Editor

texts.en: Editor is an 18-year-old businesswoman. She is married with two children and she lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. Editor has been successfully operating a stall at her local flea market for eight months now with the assistance of her family. She sells uniforms, bags and other clothing. Apart from running her business, Editor also serves as a Learner Guide at the nearest secondary school delivering sessions of life skills and well-being. With the requested Kiva loan, Editor will increase her stock by buying from wholesalers at lower costs. This would enable her to also sell at favorable prices and attract more customers. With the additional profits, she aims to open her own shop and employ people from her community.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory in bulk to reduce costs.

loans.name: Nomvuyo

texts.en: Twenty-five-year-old Nomvuyo is a single businesswoman living in the Lupane District of Zimbabwe. For the past nine months she has been operating a stall at her community’s flea market selling skirts, blouses, shirts, trousers and shoes. Currently Nomvuyo is running her business with the assistance of family members but is looking for a Kiva loan so she can employ members of her community and increase her line of merchandise. She would also use the increase in profits to pay her siblings' school fees and generally increase her way of life. When Nomvuyo is not working, she acts as a role model in her community by volunteering to teach young women about healthy lifestyle choices and business strategies.

loans.use: to increase stock to have more profit.

loans.name: Tendai

texts.en: Tendai is a 21-year-old businesswoman living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a stall at her village flea market for 18 months now with the assistance of her family. When she is not running her business, Tendai volunteers by supporting girls with guidance counseling and assisting cleaning the schools toilets. With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to purchase quality and affordable clothing from South Africa to become more competitive and improve sales and profits. With the additional profits, she aims to own her own shop and employ people from her community.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk at lower costs.

loans.name: Nomagugu

texts.en: Nomagugu is 20 years old and married with two kids. She lives in Nkayi District in Zimbabwe together with her family. She has been successfully operating a grocery shop for a year now.  In her shop she sells sugar, salt, sweets, snacks, soap, cotton, wool and sanitary pads. She is assisted by her friend as a shopkeeper. Apart from running her business, Nomagugu also volunteers in her community as health activist who disseminates health information to the people of her community. With the requested loan from Kiva, she will expand her business by purchasing more groceries at lower costs from wholesalers so as to boost sales and profits and thereby creating employment to the people of her community.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Nobukhosi

texts.en:
Nobukhosi is 20 years old and lives in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe with her parents. She volunteers her spare time assisting girls at the nearest secondary school with guidance counseling. For the past eight months, she has been successfully running a flea market stall with her parents selling clothing. 

Nobukhosi requested a loan, which she will use to purchase quality and fashionable clothing in higher quantities to improve sales and profits. With the increased profits, she aims to own her own boutique and create employment for her community.

loans.use: to purchase clothing in bulk to reduce costs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicks and chick feed

loans.name: Orlith

texts.es:
Orlith es una mujer emprendedora tiene 63 años de edad y vive en Ucayali junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos.
Desde hace más de 14 años se dedica al cultivo y comercialización de yuca, es una persona exitosa porque siempre ha ofrecido productos de calidad y al mejor precio en el mercado por lo que ya cuenta con una lista de clientes que siempre consumen sus productos. Gracias a la venta de yuca ha podido sacar adelante a sus hijos quienes hoy ya son independientes y apoyan a su familia.
Orlith está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar insumos para poder abonar las plantas, así como fertilizantes, plaguicidas para poder obtener mayor producción y por consiguiente mayores ingresos que a su vez serán utilizados para la próxima plantación y para incursionar en el cultivo de piña.
texts.en:
Orlith is a 63 year old enterprising woman who lives in Ucayali with her husband and 4 children. For more than 14 years she has grown and sold yucca. She is a successful person as she always offers a quality product at a good price on the market. So she can always count on a list of clients to buy her product. Thanks to the sales of yucca she has been able to get her children ahead. They are now adults and they support the family.

Orlith is very grateful to the lenders at Kiva as thanks to the support they provide she can buy inputs to improve her crops like fertilizer and pesticides to achieve greater production and by consequence greater income. She will use it for the next planting when she will venture into growing pineapples.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more merchandise

loans.name: Modina

texts.en:
Modina is a 30-year-old businesswoman. She is married and has four children whom she lives with in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully practicing horticulture for eight months now with the assistance of her family. She grows pumpkins, tomatoes, leafy vegetables, and onions. Modina volunteers her spare time to assist girls at the nearest secondary school in guidance counseling along with cleaning the school’s toilets. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to buy more seeds and herbicides, as well as increase the hectares for gardening so that she can produce more to sell. With additional profits she hopes to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more seeds and increase her hectares of land for gardening.

loans.name: Silindiwe

texts.en:
Silindiwe is a 28-year-old businesswoman with one child living in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running a flea market stall for three months now with the assistance of her family members. She started this business after realizing that she needed more income to sustain her family. Silindiwe volunteers her spare time assisting girls in her community in guidance and counseling. 

With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to purchase quality clothing in bulk to boost profits. With the additional profits, she intends to own a boutique and bring her brothers and sisters into the business. This would also assist her in becoming financially independent.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Sr De Ccoyllority Cachimayo Group

texts.es:
La socia Visitación  pertenece al banco comunal SR.DE CCOYLLORITY CACHIMAYO, el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cachimayo, en la Provincia de Anta y Departamento de Cusco.

 La socia Hayde  tiene 29 años de edad tiene 02 hijos y es soltera, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como ovejas entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, este préstamo es parte de una de las líneas de crédito de la Asociación Arariwa su nombre es Credi Yapa, esta línea de crédito es otorgado a los prestatarios con buen historial crediticio, siendo este un grupo que cumple dichas características.
Las socias que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunion por motivos de trabajo.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
 La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas. 
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, tienda de abarrotes, confección, venta de ropa, venta de golosinas, venta de comida, mototaxi, venta de locería.
texts.en:
These members belong to the “SR. DE CCOYLLORITY CACHIMAYO” communal bank which is located in the Cachimayo District of Anta Province, Cusco Department.

Hayde is 29 years old and has two children and is single. She alternates her daily activities with her business of raising small animals like sheep amongst others. She has been in this business for a long time and things are going well for her thanks to the effort she puts into her business every day. The member raises these animals in order to sell them to clients who order them. She wishes to continue working in this way to continue supporting her family. Hayde is requesting the loan to buy feed for her animals. She feels grateful for the loan and promises to pay her installments on time.

This loan is part of a line of loans from the Asociación Arariwa called Credi Yapa. These loans are given to members who have a good loan record, this group being one with these characteristics. The members that appear in the attached photo asked permission to arrive late due to their work commitments.

The other members work raising animals, in a grocery store, sewing, selling clothing, selling candies, selling meals, providing motorcycle taxi service and selling pottery.

loans.use: to buy feed for her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy jars, glasses, lunch Tupperware and platters.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk

loans.name: Las Del Río  (Gualaceo) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Las del Rio está formado por 9 mujeres que viven en la parroquia Jadan de Gualaceo, su clima es frio, una de sus bebidas típicas  es la chicha de jora que se comparte durante las fiestas, aún se acostumbra la vestimenta de lana que consiste de sombrero, chalina, pantalón o polleras, su gente es amable y cordial que se esfuerzan para salir adelante y sacar adelante a sus familias.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ana, tiene 33 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 18 y 12 años de edad, su primera hija pasa en casa ayudando a los quehaceres del hogar, su segundo hijo estudia en el colegio, su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que vive es propia. 
Doña Ana se dedica a la cría de borregos, cerdos, gallinas y cuyes, tienen un invernadero en donde cultiva tomates para la venta, también se dedica a la agricultura que es para el consumo de su hogar. El dinero de su crédito es para la compra de semillas, abono y fertilizante para continuar con su negocio. Su sueño es mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The Las del Rio loan group is made up of nine women who live in the Jadan de Gualaceo parish, which has a cold climate. 

One of the area's traditional drinks is "chica de jora" (a corn beer) which is shared during celebrations. Wool clothing consisting of a hat, scarf, and pants or skirt is still customary. The people are friendly and warm and strive to succeed and raise their families.

One of the members of this group is Ana. She's 33 years old, married, and has conceived two children in her conjugal union, who are 12 and 18 years old. 

Her oldest daughter spend time at home helping with household chores. Her younger son is studying in high school, and her husband works as a bricklayer. The house they live in is their own.

Ana earns her living raising sheep, pigs, chickens, guinea pigs. She has a greenhouse where she grows tomatoes to tell, and also works in agriculture for household consumption. 

The money for her loan is to buy seeds, compost and fertilizer to continue her business. Her goal is to improve her economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost and fertilizer.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI ont en moyenne  37 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des céréales, des condiments et des produits divers. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI sont à leur  8ème  prêt solidaire. SARAN 1ère  femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter  20Kgs de sucre,  20Litres d’huile et 25Kgs de farine de blé. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The Sinignessigui group  is composed of women averaging 37 years of age, with three children. They all live in polygamous families in Tominian, Segou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives and work selling cereals, condiments and miscellaneous items. After having duly repaid their prior loans, the group members are on their eight solidarity loan. Saran, the first one from left to right in the photo, plans to use her loan to buy 20 kg [44 lbs] of sugar, 20 liters [5 gal] of vegetable oil and 25 kg [55 lbs] of wheat flour. She stocks up from wholesalers locally. She sells to a mixed clientele for cash and often on credit.   She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 30,000 West African francs, which will be used for expenses related to healthcare, food, clothing and school fees, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy miscellaneous items for resale.

loans.name: Sonia Maribel

texts.es:
Sonia de 42 años de edad mujer luchadora y trabajadora, casada su esposo se desempeña como motorista de un autobús, tiene cuatro hijos los cuales viven junto a ellos; 2 están trabajando y dos se encuentran estudiando.

 La señora se dedica a la venta de pupusas y antojitos en su casa desde hace 10 años, lo aprendió de su mamá quien le a enseñado a valerse por sí misma y que pudiera desempeñar cualquier actividad productiva, en este negocio le ayudan sus hijos en el tiempo libre y se convierte en un negocio familiar 


El préstamo que está solicitando será para invertir una parte en la compra de maíz para la elaboración de las pupusas y además necesita reparar una computadora para que sus hijos que están estudiando, ya que es una herramienta importante que ellos necesitan para seguir con sus estudios académicos. 


Sus planes a futuro es que sus dos hijos que le quedan estudiando poderlos convencer de que estudien  una carrera universitaria ya que los otros dos no quisieron seguir con los estudios, y así que puedan convertirse en unos profesionales, que sus negocio siga creciendo poco a poco y seguir inculcando valores morales a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a 42 year old mother who is fighter and hard-working. She is married and her husband works as a bus driver. She has 4 children who live with her. Two of them work and two study. She has been making pupusas and snacks in her house for 10 years. Her mother taught her to manage on her own and that she was capable of doing any productive activity.

Her children help her in their spare time and it has become a family business. The loan being requested will be invested partially in buying corn to make pupusas and partially to repair a computer for one of her children who are studying. It is an important tool that they need to continue their academic studies.

Her future plans for the two children who are still studying is for them to continue to study at university to become professionals. The other two do not want to continue their studies. She wants her business to continue to grow bit by bit and she wants to continue to instill moral values to her children.

loans.use: to buy corn to make pupusas and to repair a computer for one of her children's study.

loans.name: Hingulai Group

texts.en:
Sanjulata, 37 years of age, is the leader of a group that hails from Siripur, Bhubaneswar of Khurda district of Odisha, India. Her family is comprised of her husband and two sons. The member standing first from the right with raised hand is Sanjulata. 

Sanjulata’s elder son Rajeswara has just passed his matriculation and wants to continue his studies. In the photograph he is standing just behind Sanjulata.  For higher education he wants to take admission in Intermediate Commerce (+2 commerce) at Biju Pattnayak College, Bhubaneswar. 

The monthly income of Sanjulata is about Rs.8,500 which is not at all sufficient to meet her monthly expenditures. The higher education of her son is now a financial burden. Hence she formed a group with five other members from her locality and applied for financial support from Mahashakti. It will be the first cycle loan for the group. 

The other five members of her group, Binodini, Mamata, Lilibala, Pramodini and Sandhyarani, also want a loan for the education of their children. In the photo students are standing in front of their respective mothers except for the featured member's son.

loans.use: to pay for admission in Intermediate Commerce

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a 25-year-old married businesswoman with one child living with her family in the Kwekwe District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully rearing broiler chickens for six months now, producing batches of 25 birds every six weeks. Grace is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumni network; she volunteers during her spare time assisting the elderly in her village with household chores. With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to expand her business into a poultry shop and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks and supplies

loans.name: Loice

texts.en: Loice is married with one child and lives in rural Chikomba East, Zimbabwe. To give back to her community, she volunteers as a Learner Guide working with schools to improve young people’s well-being. To earn an income for her family, Loice runs a poultry business selling broiler chickens to local residents. Her business is doing well and she wants to see it grow. A Kiva loan will allow her to buy more broiler chicks along with the feed and supplies she needs to raise them. Growth in her business will help her better provide for her family and contribute positively to her community.

loans.use: to buy more broiler chicks along with the feed and supplies she needs to raise them

loans.name: Erika Yasmín

texts.es:
Erika de 23 años de edad,  vive junto a su esposo y su hija que todavía no asiste a la escuela, junto a sus esposo son una familia muy unida. Su esposo se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas (pepinos y sandia) y juntos realizan sus cultivos.  

Ella ha trabajado desde pequeña en el cultivo de granos básicos, ya que no tuvo estudios y con su familia aprendió el trabajo, ahora le ayuda a su esposo en el cultivo de hortalizas, además su esposo vende pan por las tardes para colaborar con los ingresos del hogar. 

EL préstamo será utilizado para la compra de fertilizantes y pago del alquiler de otra porción de tierra para el cultivo de maíz.  

A futuro Erika junto a su esposo quieren que su hija tenga buenas condiciones de vida y él bebe que está por venir, velar porque no les falte nada y poder en un futuro comprar su porción de tierra para ya no tener que pagar alquiler para el cultivo de las hortalizas.
texts.en:
Erika is 23 years old and lives with her husband and daughter who doesn't go to school - they are a very united family. Her husband cultivates vegetables (cucumbers and watermelon) and together they grow their crops.

She has cultivated basic grains since she was little given that she didn't go to school and learned how to work with her family. Now she helps her husband cultivate vegetables and her husband also sells bread in the afternoons to help with household expenses.

The loan will be used to buy fertilisers and to pay for the rent on another piece of land where they will grow corn.

In future, Erika and her husband want their daughter to have good living conditions as well as the baby they have on the way, to make sure they want for nothing and to be able to buy their piece of land so that they no longer have to pay rent to grow their crops.

loans.use: buy fertilisers and to pay for the rent on another piece of land where she will grow corn.

loans.name: Ribelino

texts.es:
Ribelino es un hombre trabajador, tiene 44 años de edad y vive en el Distrito de Callaria junto a sus padres.

Al ser padre soltero, Ribelino tuvo que buscar la manera de salir adelante solo y a la vez cuidar a sus hijos y velar por su bienestar, fue difícil pero no imposible, con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación brindó a sus hijos una buena educación y los formó como personas de bien, ellos ya son adultos y no se cansan de agradecer y retribuir todo el amor y apoyo que su padre les brindó.

Desde hace 2 años trabaja como Obrero en un aserradero cerca a su casa y le va muy bien porque siempre ha sido una persona trabajadora, entusiasta, responsable y muy amable.

Ribelino está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque el apoyo que le ha brindado él podrá reparar su movilidad para que de esta manera pueda seguir movilizándose sin ningún inconveniente y seguir trabajando como lo sigue haciendo hasta ahora.
texts.en:
Ribelino is hard-working man aged 44, who lives in the district of Callaria with his parents.

Finding himself a single father, Ribelino had to find a way to move forwards alone and look after his children and their well-being. It was difficult but not impossible. With a great deal of effort and dedication, he provided his children with a good education and brought them up to be good people. They are now grow-ups and are forever grateful to him, giving him back all the love and support he gave to them.

For two years, he has worked as a labourer in a sawmill near his home, and things are going very well as he has always been a hard-working, enthusiastic, responsible and kind person.

Ribelino is grateful to Kiva lenders because the support they give him mean he can repair his vehicle. In this way, he can continue getting around without trouble and keep working as he has done up until now.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle so he can get about without trouble.

loans.name: Annamore

texts.en:
Annamore is married with three children and lives in the Chikomba East District of Zimbabwe. Since she values the education that she received, Amore volunteers as a Learner Guide working with schools in her community to encourage students to stay in school and work hard. She is also operating a hair salon where she does different types of hair styles such as hair plaiting (braiding) and crème relaxing. She loves her business and dreams of seeing it grow. 
Annamore is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase large dryers, weaves, braids, and crème relaxers for her salon to meet the high demand for business in her area. With profits from her shop, she will help women in her community feel good about themselves and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase large dryers, weaves, braids, and crème relaxers for her salon to meet the high demand for business in her area

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional merchandise for her store allowing her to diversify and increase sales

loans.name: Sinikiwe

texts.en:
Sinikiwe is a young woman of 25 years. As a single mother with two children, she works very hard to earn an income in Nkayi District, Zimbabwe. Six months ago she started her grocery business in order to provide for her children. She got the capital from selling the little maize that she harvested. As a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumni network, she volunteers in her community as a Learner Guide at the local secondary school. Learner Guides work with students to teach them life and study skills. Sinikiwe is passionate about the power that education has to transform a community and is eager to share her knowledge about life and business with local students. 
With the requested Kiva loan, Sinikiwe wants to expand her business by purchasing groceries at lower prices from wholesalers. By purchasing the items in bulk, she will reduce her costs and be able to increase her sales. With the profits she will educate her two children and help the needy in her community.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more handbags,shoes, and dresses to sell

loans.name: Santanat

texts.ru: Сантанат 57 лет и живет она в районе Кубадиён с мужем, сыновьями, невестками и внуками. У них большая и дружная семья. Сантанант вместе с мужем три года назад начали бизнес по животноводству. Они в своем скотном дворе разводят коров и телят мясной и молочной породы. Муж и жена сами ухаживают за скотом, им в старости лет это дело по душе, так как не требует тяжелой работы. Сантанат и ее муж хотят сейчас увеличить поголовье скотов. Но так как у них самих не хватает денежных средств для купли телят, Сантанат обратилась за кредитом. Она надеется, что их поддержат.
texts.en: Santanat is 57 years old and lives in the Qubadiyon district with her husband, sons, daughters-in-law and grandchildren. They have a large and friendly family. Santanat and her husband started an animal husbandry business three years ago. They raise cows and calves of beef and dairy breeds on their livestock yard. The husband and wife take care of the livestock themselves, and at their old age this business is satisfying since it does not require hard labor. Santanat and her husband now want to increase their livestock headcount, but because they do not have enough money, Santanat requested a loan. She hopes that they will be supported.

loans.use: to buy a couple of calves

loans.name: Vaipanoa

texts.en: Vaipanoa is a 53-year-old woman who is married with 5 children. She has a small tailoring business to earn a living. She has been running this business for 5 years. Vaipanoa needs a loan to buy material, thread, a new sewing machine, needles, and a measuring tape. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Vaipanoa joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, thread, a new sewing machine, needles, and a measuring tape

loans.name: Sue

texts.en: Sue is a 66-year-old married woman with 8 children. She makes and sells meat pies in her community to earn a living. She has 10 years of experience with this business. Sue needs a loan to buy a new stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, onions, soya sauce, and a deep pot. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sue has been a member of SPBD since 2004.

loans.use: to buy a new stove, bags of flour, cooking oil, onions, soya sauce, and a deep pot

loans.name: Tuloto

texts.en:
Tuloto is 42 years old and married with no children. 
She has a small peanut farm and sells peanuts in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 11 years. Tuloto needs a loan to buy chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, plastic bags, and a new oven. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2003. Tuloto will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, plastic bags, and a new oven

loans.name: Ilaisa

texts.en: Ilaisa is a 49-year-old divorced woman with 6 children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has 5 years of experience with this business. Ilaisa needs a loan to buy cordials, a bag of sugar, a large barrel, a large spoon, Chinese candy, and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to to pay for her children's education. Ilaisa has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy cordials, a bag of sugar, a large barrel, a large spoon, Chinese candy, and foam cups

loans.name: Alaga

texts.en: Alaga is 50 years old and married with 4 children. She owns and operates a small store, selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for 3 years. Alaga needs a loan to buy a new chest freezer, a hanging scale, snacks, and soft drinks. She hopes to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She became a member of SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new chest freezer, a hanging scale, snacks, and soft drinks

loans.name: Bester

texts.en:
As a single woman, Bester works hard to run her business selling casual wear, formal wear, school uniforms, and blankets in the area of Chikomba East, Zimbabwe where she lives. Bester spends her free time volunteering as a Learner Guide teaching students life skills that can help them after their schooling is complete. 
Bester is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can add to her stock, which will allow her to sell other items such as children’s wear, shoes, underwear, skirts, and trousers. Diversifying her stock will increase her sales and continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to add to her stock, which will allow her to sell other items such as children’s wear, shoes, underwear, skirts, and trousers

loans.name: José Santos

texts.es:
José de 56 años de edad, es un padre de familia ejemplar como menciona su esposa con quien vive desde hace 30 años, José estudio hasta el 4 grado de educación básica,  ya que menciona que no le gustaba mucho el estudio y que le gustaba más el trabajo del campo, sus 5 hijos ya están mayores y ya formaron su propia familia actualmente vive junto a varios nietos.

José una persona responsable y luchadora trabaja la tierra en el cultivo de granos básicos y con el esfuerzo que ha realizado logro instalar su pequeña tienda y un molino de nixtamal, desde pequeño le ha gustado el trabajo agrícola, por lo cual el decidió abandonar la escuela, en cuanto al negocio de la tienda que posee le ayuda su esposa a administrarlo.  


El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para mejorar del techo y las paredes donde tiene el molino de nixtamal,  ya que menciona que tiene varios años y ahora que ya vienen las lluvias quiere reconstruir el techo para que los clientes no se mojen. 

José quiere seguir luchando para siempre seguir adelante y poder inculcarle a sus nietos valores que les ayuden a salir adelante y que sean unas personas de bien para la sociedad, además seguir trabajando y que sus clientes se sientan felices cuando lo visitan para realizar sus compras.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old, and according to his wife he is an exemplary father. They have lived together for over 30 years. José left education after the 4th grade, as he says he didn't really enjoy school and preferred working in the countryside. His five children are already grown up and have their own families. At the moment, he lives with several of his grandchildren.

José is a hard-working, responsible person who works the land growing basic grains. With his hard work, he has managed to set up a small shop and install a mill to grind corn for tortillas. He has enjoyed farming from a young age, which is why he decided to leave school. He also helps his wife manage the store he owns.

The loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to improve the roof and walls of the premises in which his mill to grind corn for tortillas is housed, as it is quite a few years old and now that the rainy season is coming, he wants to rebuild the room to stop his customers getting wet.

José wants to continue fighting to keep moving forwards, and so that he can teach his grandchildren values that help them to succeed and become good citizens. He also wants to keep working, and for his customers to be happy when they visit him to do their shopping.

loans.use: to improve the roof and walls of the premises in which his mill to grind corn for tortillas is housed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Marygold

texts.en: Marygold lives in the Chikomba East of Zimbabwe where she volunteers as a Learner Guide working with schools in her community to improve young people’s well-being. In addition, Marygold runs her own shop selling groceries such as sugar, cooking oil, flour, and soap to her community. Through hard work and dedication, she dreams of seeing her small business expand. Marygold is seeking a Kiva loan so that she can purchase groceries in bulk and add new products to her shop. Marygold hopes to increase her income and improve her standard of living with additional profits.

loans.use: to purchase groceries in bulk and add new products to her shop

loans.name: Azizmurod

texts.ru:
Азизмурод жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 34 лет. Он женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Азизмурод живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Азизмурода также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Азизмурод занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Азизмурода в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Азизмурода хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Азизмурод очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Azizmurod is an optimistic and hard-working 34-year old man. He is married and has one child. This is the first time he has reached out to Arvand after learning about an opportunity for financial support. Azizmurod lives with his family in a rural area. He did not receive higher education since he was unable to go to college due to financial difficulties in his family. Azizmurod’s wife has no college degree, either; she is a homemaker, taking care of the household and raising [their child].

In order to support himself, Azizmurod has his own business. He fattens and resells cattle. He earns a decent income from this work. His wife also helps him in the business; she sells the milk they obtain. At present Azizmurod would like to increase his livestock in order to expand his business. This is why he has applied to Arvand for a loan to buy cattle. Azizmurod is really hoping for a  positive outcome and thanks Arvand for support in advance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Nomagugu

texts.en:
Nomagugu is a 35-year-old businesswoman. She is a widow with three children and lives in Nkayi District, Zimbabwe. She has been operating a grocery business for one year and has no employees at the moment. Nomagugu is a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumni network where she volunteers as a Learner Guide teaching students life skills. She is also a behavior change facilitator and volunteers at the local clinic. 
Nomagugu is requesting a Kiva loan in order to buy groceries in bulk. This bulk purchase will help her boost sales and profits. With the profits she hopes to expand into a larger retail business, create employment, and provide for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothes and footwear to sell

loans.name: Yiriwa Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe YIRIWA ont en moyenne  45 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à TOMINIAN/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, du savon  et des habits. Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe YIRIWA sont à leur  5ème  prêt solidaire. NOELI 1ère  femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo ;  compte utiliser son prêt pour  acheter   7 pièces de Wax, 15 jupes, 15 robes, 10 chemises et 10 pantalons. Elle s’approvisionne sur place chez les grossistes. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé, à la nourriture, à l’habillement, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en: The women of the Yiriwa Group have an average age of 45 and four children each. They all live within the frameworks of traditional extended families in Tominian, Ségou Region (the fourth administrative area of the Republic of Mali). They all know each other through the bonds of family and they earn a living from the buying and selling of condiments, soap and clothing. After having fully paid back their previous loans, this will be the fifth loan for the women of the Yiriwa Group. Noeli, the first woman to the left of the photo, plans on buying seven sheets of wax prints, 15 skirts, 15 gowns, 10 shirts and 10 pairs of trousers. She gets her stock from the wholesalers and sells it to a mixed customer base made up of both men and women, in exchange for cash and, often, for credit. She plans on making an average monthly profit of 40,000 FCFA, which will be used to pay for costs relating to health care, food, clothing and school fees. The rest will be reinvested into her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase clothes in bulk to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for efficient cooking energy using Liquefied Petroleum Gas

loans.name: Feruza

texts.ru: Феруза молодая портниха в возрасте 21 года. Она в течение 3 лет принимает заказы на пошив штор, занавесей и портьер в своем районе Спитамен. Феруза освоила это дело самостоятельно, так как эта работа для нее всегда представляло интерес. Она следит за модой и всегда в курсе новых фасонов, тканей, фурнитуры и т.д. Феруза стремится выполнить каждый заказ в максимально короткий срок и ей в этом помогают члены семьи. Клиентки довольны ее работами, поэтому ее услуги всегда в спросе. Сейчас Феруза обратилась за кредитом, так как ей не хватает финансовых средств, чтобы закупить ткани и необходимые принадлежности для шитья портьер. Она ждет вашу поддержку.
texts.en: Feruza is a young seamstress, who is 21 years old. She has been accepting orders for sewing drapes and curtains for 3 years in her district of Spitamen. Feruza learned this business by herself because this work always interested her. She keeps track of fashion and is always aware of new styles, fabrics and accessories. Feruza tries to complete each order in a maximally short amount of time, and her family members help her with it. The clients are pleased with her work, and this is why her service is always in demand. Now Feruza requested a loan because she does not have enough financial means to purchase fabrics and necessary accessories for sewing drapes. She awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase fabrics and necessary accessories for sewing drapes

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru:
Бахринисо жительница района Спитамен. Ей 42 года. Она занимается животноводческой деятельностью, так как в ее районе имеются все условия для ведения этого вида деятельности. Бахринисо замужем, имеет двух сыновей и дочь. Ее муж и старший сын предоставляют услуги мастера по ремонту домов. Остальные дети учатся в школе.
В течение 6 лет Бахринисо разводит крупнорогатый и мелкорогатый скот. Она просит кредит для увеличения поголовья скотин, так как их осталось в ее хозяйстве считанное количество. Бахринисо надеется, что ее поддержат в развитии дела.
texts.en:
Bahriniso is a resident of the Spitamen district. She is 42 years old. She is involved in an animal husbandry business because this district has all of the right conditions for running this type of business. Bahriniso is married and has two sons and a daughter. Her husband and oldest son provide house repair services. The rest of the children attend school.

Bahriniso has been raising cattle and small livestock for 6 years. She is requesting this loan to increase livestock headcount because she has a small number of livestock left. Bahriniso hopes that she will be supported in developing her business.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to develop her business

loans.name: Marinda

texts.en:
Marinda is a 24-year-old woman who is unwed, with two children. She has a small sewing business to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years. 

Marinda needs a loan to buy thread, needles, zippers, material, measuring tape, and a new sewing machine. She will use her profits to pay for her children's education. Marinda joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2011 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, zippers, material, measuring tape, and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Carmen Johanna

texts.es:
Carmen tiene 29 años de edad, de estado civil soltera, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Carmen se dedica, a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz  Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida con la finalidad de mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mejorar la producción de sus cultivos. Su desafío es el transporte. En su tiempo libre le gusta ver las noticias.
texts.en: 29-year-old Carmen, who is single, lives with her parents in the Ventanas canton on the province of Los Ríos. She is a member of the Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo solidarity group which is based in the city of Pueblo Viejo. The group is made up of 10 members from the same city who all work in agriculture and livestock breeding. Carmen grows corn and is seeking this loan to buy manure, insecticide, fertiliser, urea and weed killer to help her to grow more crops. She will buy the supplies in Ventanas. Her aim is to grow more crops but she has to face the challenge of transporting them around. In her spare time, she likes to watch the news.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Nhóm 1 Thôn 6 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lan works in agriculture, farming food. Lan has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital.

Lan is 38 years old and she is married with two children. She lives with two dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Lan joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 1 thôn 6 Quảng Đại solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell.

In the future, Lan hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: 10 Lộc Tiên Hải Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Huệ works in agriculture raising marine aquaculture. She is requesting a loan to purchase equipment to make salt. 

Huệ is 40 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of a seven-member group, the 10 Lộc Tiên Hải Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Huệ's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huệ has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huệ hopes to build a new house, for her business to do well, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to make salt.

loans.name: Cristiam Reynaldo

texts.es:
Cristiam tiene 20 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus padres en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos.
Es integrante de la ventanilla Cuidad de Pueblo Viejo  se encuentra ubicada en la ciudad de Pueblo Viejo, está formada por 10 socios que son de la misma ciudad y que se dedican a las labores agrícolas y pecuarias.
Cristiam se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Solicita el crédito para la compra de abono, insecticida, fertilizantes, urea, fungicida. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo. Su desafío es la  influencia del clima y plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Cristiam is a 20-year-old farmer, single, and lives with his parents in Ventanas Canton in De Los Rios Province. In his spare time, he likes to play sports. Cristiam is a member of the Pueblo Viejo City Communal Bank, along with nine other members from Pueblo Viejo who are farmers and ranchers. 

Cristiam grows corn and rice on his farm. He would like to purchase a vehicle, and also faces challenges such as the effects of weather and pests on his crops. He is applying for a loan to purchase manure, insecticide, fertilizer, urea, and fungicide in Ventanas.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, insecticide, manure, and fungicide for planting corn.

loans.name: 02 Đông Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thủy has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase clothing to resell.

Thủy is 32 years old, married, and has two children. Thủy is the group leader of the 02 Đông Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for three years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Nhóm 44 Tây Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Hai is applying for a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. She works in agriculture, raising poultry and cattle.

Hai is 52 years old, married, and has three children. Hai is the group leader of the 44 Tây Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

In 2010, Hai joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hai has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hai has been involved in this business for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hai hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thái Hòa, Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Loan is 45 years old, married, and has three children. She  is the group leader of the 01 Thái Hòa, Hưng Lộc solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

Loan operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables, which she has been doing for six years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Loan requested her second loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women, which she will use to purchase vegetables to sell. In 2010, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. In the future, Loan hopes that her business does well, her family is healthy and happy, and she has the ability to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables

loans.name: Nhom 2 Thôn 6 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hằng works in agriculture, farming food. Hằng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is lack of capital. 

Hằng is 42 years old and she is married with three children. She lives with three dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Hằng is the group leader of the Nhóm 2 thôn 6 Quảng Đại solidarity group, which consists of four members. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell. This is Hằng's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Hằng hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell

loans.name: Blanca Beiba

texts.es:
La señora Blanca vive felizmente con su esposo (Ver Foto) en una finca ubicada en zona rural de La Ceja municipio de Antioquia. Juntos han logrado sacar adelante algunos cultivos de alimentos como papa y zanahoria, actividad aprendida por ella desde que era un niña al lado de sus padres.
Desde hace aproximadamente 4 años se han estado dedicando al cultivo de flores y hortensias y han tratado de tener unas buenas cosechas para vender.
Ella solicita un préstamo para comprar algunos insumos como semillas y fertilizantes para darle más vida a su plantación.
De este modo tendrá unas flores mucho más radiantes y con mejor calidad, obteniendo así muy buena rentabilidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Blanca lives happily with her husband (see photo) on a farm situated in the rural area of La Ceja municipality of Antioquia. Together they have managed to achieve success with food crops such as potatoes and carrots. She learnt this job as a girl at the side of her parents.

They have been growing hydrangea flowers for the past 4 years, and have tried to achieve good harvests for sale.

She is asking for a loan to buy some supplies such as seeds and fertilisers to give more life to her crop. This way, she will achieve much more radiant flowers of a better quality, which will produce a good return for her business.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies for her crops.

loans.name: Mahamayee Group

texts.en:
Basanti is the leader of a group that lives in a rental colony of Bhubaneswar of Khurda district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 37 years. She has a family comprised of five members. The member standing at extreme left with raised hand is Basanti. 

She has been managing a dairy firm in her locality. There is huge demand for milk and dairy products in the locality and of course at different hotels also. Her husband helps her to manage the dairy firm.

Out of her small income Basanti is maintaining her family in a low profile. To improve her living condition and to earn some extra income, she wants to access a loan from Mahashakti. At present her monthly income is Rs.6,000. From the loan she will purchase a cow. She dreams of having a Pacca (brick-built) house of her own.

The other five members also want a loan for a hotel, vegetable vending, tailoring and a milk business.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Hanz Dany

texts.es:
Hanz vive en el populoso distrito del Rimac junto a su madre y su hermana, su padre los abandono hace años cuando era muy chico por lo que su madre los crió sola. Todos en casa trabajan y aportan en los gastos ayudándose mutuamente, su madre es docente jubilada y recibe una muy baja pensión, su hermana estudia y trabaja al igual que Hanz ganando solo lo necesario para pagar sus estudios. El es ayudante de mecánica en un taller a medio tiempo y lo poco que gana no le alcanza para cubrir sus estudios y apoyar ademas en los gastos del hogar por lo que deberá dejar de estudiar para trabajar a tiempo completo de no contar con el apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva.
El desea terminar sus estudios y poner un pequeño taller de mecánica y así poder ir creciendo poco a poco para poder ayudar a su madre y hermana, y no solo eso sino también a otros jóvenes que como el necesitan de trabajar y estudiar para lograr sus metas. Es por todo lo dicho que el se encuentra muy agradecido con todo el apoyo que pueden brindarle los prestamistas de Kiva porque con ello no solo lo están ayudando a el a lograr sus metas sino también a que el posteriormente también pueda ayudar a otros a lograrlas.
Hanz piensa que la mejor manera de ayudar a alguien es dándole las herramientas necesarias para salir adelante y de ellas la mas importante es sin duda la educación, por esto le parece una gran causa y labor la realizada por todos los prestamistas de Kiva alrededor del mundo.
texts.en:
Hanz lives in the populous district of Rimac with his mother and sister.  His father abandoned them years ago when he was a small boy, and so his mother raised both Hanz and his sister alone.  Everyone in their house works to support the home expenses.  His mother is a retired teacher and she receives a very small pension.  His sister is studying and working, just like Hanz, and earning just enough to pay for her studies.  

Hanz is a part-time mechanical assistant in a workshop, and the small amount that he earns is not enough to cover his educational fees and to also support the home expenses.  Therefore, he may need to stop studying in order to work full-time if he is unable to secure additional financial assistance through Kiva.

He hopes to finish his studies and to open a small mechanics shop.  He hopes to grow his business little by little so that he can help not only his mother and sister, but also other young people who are trying to work and study to reach their goals.  For these reasons, he is extremely grateful for all the support that the Kiva investors have offered him.  With this support, he will be able to achieve his own dreams and later help others to reach their goals.

Hanz thinks that the best way to help someone is to provide them with the necessary tools to move themselves ahead.  The most important tool is education.  For this reason, he feels that the Kiva investors around the world offer their support to a great cause.

loans.use: to pay educational fees for his mechanical maintenance studies.

loans.name: Ramón Alberto

texts.es:
Ramón de 38 años de edad, quien estudio hasta 6 grado de educación básica, recientemente se acaba de acompañar para formar su propia familia, actualmente vive junto a sus padres y su ahora compañera de vida.  

Él es empleado en una ferretería cerca de su casa desde hace 3 años, además en el tiempo libre se dedica al trabajo agrícola junto a su padre que siempre trabajan juntos desde hace varios años y fue él quien le ha enseñado el trabajo e inculcado valores morales y éticos.  

El préstamo que está solicitando  credicampo, es para  el pago del alquiler del terreno donde junto a su padre van a cultivar los granos básicos. 

Ramón desea trabajar arduamente para en un futuro darle lo mejor a su compañera de vida y a sus hijos que vendrán en un futuro no muy lejano, menciona el cliente.
texts.en:
Ramón is 38 years old and left school after the 6th grade. He recently met a partner with whom he plans to start a family, and he currently lives with his parents and his partner.

Ramón has been employed at a hardware store near his home for three years. In his free time, he works farming with his father. For a number of years, they  have worked together, and it was his father who taught him how to work and instilled in him ethical and moral values.

The loan he is requesting from Credicampo is to pay to rent a plot of land on which he and his father are going to grow basic grains.

Ramón says he wants to work hard to offer a better future to his partner and his children, which he hopes to have in the near future.

loans.use: to pay to rent a plot of land on which he and his father are going to grow basic grains.

loans.name: Mayibongwinkosi

texts.en:
Twenty-year-old Mayibongwinkosi lives in the Lupane District of Zimbabwe where she operates a stall at the village flea market selling products such as table covers, men’s hats, school shoes, and apparel. She has been successfully running the business for two years now and thinks it is time to expand. 

Mayibongwinkosi is a proud member of Cama, Camfed’s alumni network, and has received training on business strategies and finance management. On top of all that Mayibongwinkosi finds the time to volunteer with her local primary schools food program. This Kiva loan would allow her to expand her business by buying more merchandise so she can provide for her family and assist other children in need in her community.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more merchandise

loans.name: Jjuntos Triunfaremos En Cocachacra Group

texts.es: Lili tiene 52 años de edad es conviviente con hijos independientes. Ella hace 02 años implemento una pequeña ferretería en su vivienda. Y a la vez vende frutas que producen en la zona que radica. El crédito lo invertira en la compra de pinturas clavos focos alambres. Su mayor deseo es ampliar su ferretería. El grupo “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHACRA” agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Lili es la segunda del lado derecho viste blusa blanca
texts.en:
Lili is 52 years old, is in a common-law relationship, with independent children. Two years ago she created a small hardware store in her home, and, at the same time, sells fruits that are grown in the area where she resides. She will invest the loan in the purchase of paint, nails, light bulbs, and wires. Her greatest wish is to expand her hardware store. 

The “JUNTOS TRIUNFAREMOS EN COCACHARA” (TOGETHER WE WILL TRIUMPH IN COCACHARA) group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Lili is the second from the right wearing the white blouse.

loans.use: to buy more paint, nails, light bulbs, and wires.

loans.name: 01 Thôn 4 Quảng Giao Group

texts.en:
Chung is applying for a loan to purchase dry food and general things to resell. 

Chung is 26 years old and is married with one child.
Chung is the leader of the 01 Thôn 4 Qquang Giao Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 

In 2013, Chung joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Chung has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Chung has been involved in her business for six years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chung hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase dry food and general things to resell.

loans.name: 02060305 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Thinh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more poultry to raise and sell.

Thinh is 59 years old and she is single with one child.
Thinh is the group leader of the 02060305 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. 
Thinh lives in the Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thinh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thinh has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thinh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thinh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thinh hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Nhóm 13 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Khuyến works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase poultry to raise and sell.

Khuyến is 45 years old and is married with two children.
Khuyến is the group leader of the Nhóm 13 Thôn 3 Quảng Nhân Solidarity Group which consists of five members. 

This is Khuyến first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.
Khuyến has been involved in her business for nine years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Khuyến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase poultry to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jose Balbino

texts.es:
José, requiere un nuevo crédito para invertir en el cultivo de maíz, comprara abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, insecticidas y semilla, teniendo los insumos agrícolas básicos garantiza la preparación del terreno y una cosecha muy productiva.
Con el préstamo anterior José logro mejorar la productividad de su siembra, ha tenido mayores ingresos con lo que ofrece a su familia una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud, además le permite ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas.
texts.en:
José is asking for a new loan to invest in corn cultivation; he will buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, and seeds. Having the basic agricultural inputs ensures the readiness of the land and a very productive crop. 

With the previous loan, Jose was able to improve upon the productivity of his crop. He has had a higher income, with which he offers his family better nourishment, clothing, and health. Furthermore, it allows him to be punctual in the payment of his dues.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, insecticides, and seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for helping her coffee plants.

loans.name: Tapuitea

texts.en:
Tapuitea is 35 years old and married, with two children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for four years. 

Tapuitea needs a loan to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a tiller, gloves, and new gum boots. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. Tapuitea will use the profits from her sales to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a wheelbarrow, a crowbar, a tiller, gloves, and new gum boots.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: Maria de 64 años de edad, dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras, fresas, plátanos, naranjas, tomates, cebollas, chiles entre otros tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, el lugar donde comercia es muy estratégico para la actividad y además muy concurrido de personas, ya tiene mucha clientela que la prefieren porque su producto es fresco, a buen precio, de calidad y con un excelente servicio; Maria es una mujer emprendedora, dedicada a su labor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, siempre está buscando alternativas que le permitan alcanzar el éxito, en las últimas semanas aumento la demanda y quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión pero no posee de suficiente capital que la respalde por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar frutas y verduras por mayor. Maria  tiene buenas referencias de pago, esta agradecida con el apoyo y asegura que podrá saldar la deuda, a la vez confía que le dará a su familia una vida mejor.
texts.en:
Maria, 64 years old, sells fruit and vegetables, such as strawberries, bananas, oranges, tomatoes, onions, chilies, and others. She has had the business for several years, which has given her lots of sales experience that allows her to earn the greatest profit possible. She sells in a very strategic location, crowded with people. She already has many customers that prefer her because her products are fresh, of good quality, and sold with excellent service. 

Maria is an enterprising woman. She is eager to get ahead in her work, always looking for new ways that allow her to succeed. In recent weeks demand has increased. She wants to take advantage of it by making a new investment, but she does not have enough capital to back it up. This is why she requests a loan from INTEGRAL that will allow her to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

Maria has references of good payment. She is thankful for the support and is certain that she can repay the debt, trusting that it will give her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables at wholesale.

loans.name: Dúo Brisas De Barcenas Group

texts.es:
Duo Brisas de Barcenas

Florinda, es madre soltera de 7 hijos ( 19, 17, 15, 9, 6, 4,4,) de los cuales solamente dos asisten a la escuela de su comunidad, ella inicio vendiendo fruta fresca en la puerta de su domicilio hace cuatro años cuando se separo de su esposo, y tuvo la necesidad de trabajar para obtener el sustento de su familia, ella agradece mucho la oportunidad de obtener crédito ya que gracias a eso ella actualmente tiene una tienda de artículos de consumo diario, venta de tortilla y frutas frescas, ahnela tener una casa propia para no tener que seguir pagando alquiler y dejarle a sus hijos un patrimonio, agradece mucho a Dios las bendiciones tan grandes que ha obtenido en su vida,esta solicitando este credito para la compra productos de consumo diario para la venta.
texts.en: Florinda is a single mother of seven children (ages 19, 17, 15, 9, 6, 4, 4) of which only two attend the school in their community. She began selling fresh fruit at the door of her home four years ago when she separated from her husband and needed to work to obtain sustenance for her family. She really appreciates the opportunity to obtain a loan, now that thanks to that she currently has a store of articles of daily consumption, tortilla sales and fresh fruit. She aspires to have her own house in order to not have to continue paying rent and to leave her children an inheritance. She thanks God very much for the great blessings that she has obtained in her life. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of daily consumer products to sell.

loans.use: to buy daily consumer products to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar panel for her home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase agricultural inputs and pay labor costs to tend to her coffee crops.

loans.name: 02060321 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu Group

texts.en:
Ms. Tuyên works in agriculture raising crab and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby crabs and shrimp to raise and sell in future.

Tuyên is 32 years old and she is single with two children. She is the group leader of the 02060321 Đại Giang - Hoằng Châu solidarity group, which consists of six members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

In 2003, Tuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Tuyên has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Tuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tuyên hopes for her children to do well in school, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby crabs and shrimp to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 13-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Thường has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry food to resell.

Thường is 51 years old and is married with two children.
Thường is the group leader of the 13-Nam Ngạn Solidarity Group which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Thường has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Thường has been involved in her business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Thường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thường hopes to build a new house, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more dry food to resell

loans.name: Zarobiddin

texts.ru:
Заробиддин жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 26 лет. Он женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Сам Заробиддин живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он  имеет высшее образование, но его жена не имеет высшее образование, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Поэтому является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Заробиддин занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Заробиддину в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Заробиддин хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Заробиддин очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Zarobiddin is a happy and hardworking 26-year-old man. He is married and has one child. Zarobiddin lives with his family in a rural area. He has a higher education, but his wife does not because she could not attend a university due to her family's financial hardships. This is why she is a homemaker, involved in house work and raising children.

Zarobiddin is involved in his own business to have an income for food. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. He has a good income from this business. The wife also helps Zarobiddin with the business by selling milk obtained from the livestock. Now Zarobiddin wants to increase his livestock headcount in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain this loan to buy livestock. Zarobiddin hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
Al llegar al puesto de doña Maria Auxiliadora, de 43 años, una gama de colores alegres esta presente. Es aquí donde hay una diversidad de ropa calzados y adornos de todos los estilos que lleva vendiendo por 11 años. Junto a ella se encuentra su única hija de 13 años, quien todas las mañanas se levanta junto con ella para cuidar el negocio, pero que al medio día se viste con su camisa blanca y falda azul para ir al colegio. 
Las metas de Maria Auxiliadora siempre han sido seguir creciendo, es por esta razón que necesita un préstamo para comprar más camisas, faldas, ropa interior, sandalias, zapatos cerrados, entre otros productos de mayor demanda en este mes de las madres. Este préstamo, le permitirá crecer sus ingresos, que le servirán para poder pagar el colegio de su hija, quien sueña en convertirse en toda una profesional con su título. Entre sus planes esta mejorar su casa y convertirse en una persona autosuficiente  en no más de 10 años.
texts.en:
Upon arriving at the stand of Maria Auxiliadora, age 43, a spectrum of happy colors is present.  Here there is a great variety of clothing, shoes, and accessories in every style.  She has been selling these for 11 years.  Together with Maria Auxiliadora can be found her only daughter, aged 13.  Every morning she goes with her to take care of the business, but at noon, she puts on her white top and blue skirt to go to school.

Maria Auxiliadora’s goal has always been to keep growing.  It is because of this that she needs a loan to buy more shirts, skirts, underwear, sandals, shoes, and other high-demand items for this Mother’s month.  This loan will allow her to expand her earnings, which will help her to be able to pay for her daughter’s schooling.  Her daughter dreams of becoming a professional with a degree.  Among her plans are to improve her house and become a self-sufficient person in no more than ten years.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, skirts, underwear, sandals, and shoes, among other items.

loans.name: Mairent

texts.en:
Mairent is a Kubo Financiero client and this is her story.
Mairent says that both her husband and her father-in-law manufacture earrings and other jewelry, and once that she didn't have money to buy milk for her 8 month baby, she decided to go to the street and look for new clients, that was more than 14 years ago. Today she has many recurring clients and she has diversify to other products like cosmetics. 
She is asking for an additional loan to buy newer models and provide more variety of products to her clients, she has always payed on time.

loans.use: to buy new jewelry models to offer more variety to her clients.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.en:
María del Carmen is an entrepreneur and Kubo.financiero client, and this is her story:

María is 37 years old, is married to Juan Manuel and has two children; one son of 4 and one daughter of 18 years old. They originate from Huitzilzingo, a Mexico City suburb, and consider themselves a very united family.

She is a stylist and has her own salon, where she offers women and men haircuts and prepares clients for special events such as weddings, quince años and much more. Her business is located beside her house and her daughter helps her there.

María asked for this loan to buy merchandise for her business, specifically hair dyes for her female customers. The accomplishments she has achieved thanks to her work are buying her house and providing for her family. Her goals are to expand her business and to open a flower bouquet business.

loans.use: to buy hair dyes for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a 28-year-old young businesswoman living in the Lupane District of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully running her own a grocery shop for the past 8 months where she sells household products such as cooking oil, sugar, mealie-meal, sugar beans, washing powder, soft drinks and stationery. 

Amina is a role model within her community and inspires other young women by helping the elderly and being a positive influence to others. Amina would like to use a Kiva loan to expand her business by increasing her stock. She hopes to continually grow the business and increase its profitability thus being able to better provide for her family’s needs and continue to be a positive example in her community.

loans.use: to expand her business by increasing her stock.

loans.name: 02030834 _ Tây Xuân Vi _ Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thức works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

Thức is 24 years old and she is married with one child. She is the group leader of the 02030834 _ Tây Xuân Vi _ Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of four members. Thức lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Thức joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for five years. The main hardship that Thức faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thức hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby poultry to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 09-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Ms. Nga operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish and shrimp. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish and shrimp to resell

Nga is 50 years old and she is single with one child. She is the group leader of the 09-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2009, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid seven loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nga hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and shrimp to resell

loans.name: 03-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phượng operates a food stall/restaurant selling rice noodle for breakfast. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice and meat to make rice noodle for selling. 

Phượng is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the group leader of the 03-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Phượng joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. The main hardship that Phượng faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Phượng hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice and meat to make rice noodle for selling.

loans.name: 10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. An operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. The main hardship that An faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

An is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her 2 dependents.
