In 2013, An joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. An has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. An is the group leader of the 10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, An hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Chamnan is a 27-year-old married woman. She lives in a remote area of Kampong Cham Province with her husband and three unmarried children. She and her spouse are farmers in the rice field near their house, with a daily income of about USD 3.

Chamnan has been a reliable client of HKL for one loan cycle already. Recently, she would like to request one more loan from KIVA to pay for a motorbike since she never has any vehicle to use. She hopes that this low interest loan can make her life more comfortable in transportation. Finally, she would like to express her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to pay for a motorbike.

loans.name: 030206090002.9.thiệu Vận Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thạch operates a recycled materials business. She is requesting a loan to purchase waste materials to resell (to factories that can recycle). Thạch has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Thạch is 42 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Thạch joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 7 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thạch is the group leader of the 030206090002.9.Thiệu Vận solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, Thạch hopes to have enough to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase waste materials to resell (to factories that can recycle).

loans.name: 04 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hướng works in agriculture raising poultry.  Hướng has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Hướng is 46 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, she joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hướng is the group leader of the 04 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. With her business profit, Hướng hopes for her business to do well, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Humberto Enrrique

texts.es:
Humberto esta agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado podrá comprar artefactos para su vivienda como una cocina a gas y refrigeradora, ya que actualmente con cuentan con estos implemento, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida sobre todo elaborar sus alimentos en una cocina adecuada y conservar los alimentos en optimas condiciones.

Humberto con esta mejora podrá seguir trabajando en su empleo como chófer de mototaxi, trabajo que su única fuente de ingresos para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo de 9 meses y poder luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Humberto is grateful with the Kiva lenders, as thanks to the help that they have brought him, he will be able to buy machines for his home such as a gas stove and refrigerator. As now to have these implemented, in this way he will be able to improve his quality of life, above all preparing his food in a proper kitchen and keeping his food in optimal conditions. 

With this improvement, Humberto will be able to keep working in his job as a motorcycle taxi driver, work that is his only source of income to bring his young son of nine months out ahead, and to be able to fight to make his big dream of having his own house a reality.

loans.use: to buy electric appliance machines (stove, refrigerator).

loans.name: Hanifa

texts.ru:
Ханифа жизнерадостная и трудолюбивая женщина в возрасте 50 лет. Она никогда не была  замужем и детей не имеет. Всю свою жизнь она жила ради своих родителей, делала всё возможное чтобы им угодить. Но несмотря на одиночество, Ханифа полна радости и желания жить. Она обратилась в Арванд впервые, когда узнала, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку. 

Сама Ханифа живёт в сельской местности. Она не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Ханифа занимается своим бизнесом. Она занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Она также продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Ханифа хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому она обратилась  в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Ханифа очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Hanifa is a happy and hardworking 50-year-old woman. She was never married and does not have children. She has lived all of her life for her parents, doing everything possible to please them. Despite being alone, Hanifa is full of happiness and desire to live. She came to Arvand for the first time when she had learned that there was an opportunity to get financial support.

Hanifa lives in a rural area. She does not have a higher education because she could not attend a university due to financial hardships in her family. Hanifa is involved in her own business to have an income for food. She is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. She also sells milk obtained from the livestock. Now Hanifa wants to increase her livestock headcount in order to expand her business. This is why she came to Arvand and wants to obtain this loan to buy livestock. Hanifa hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand in advance for the support.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Aval

texts.ru:
Авал жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 48 лет. Он женат и имеет 3-их детей. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Авал живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он имеет высшее образование, но не смог найти подходящую работу в местном селе, где живёт. Жена Авала не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Авал занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. От данного дела он получает хороший доход. Жена также помогает Авала в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Авал имеет несколько голов скота, которые готовы к продаже, поэтому он хочет ещё увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Для этого он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Авал очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Aval is a happy and hardworking 48-year-old man. He is married and has 3 children. Aval comes to Arvand for the first time after learning about the opportunity to obtain financial support. Aval lives with his family in a rural area. He has a higher education, but could not find suitable work at the local village, where he lives. His wife does not have the higher education because she could not attend a university due to her family's financial hardships. She is a homemaker, involved in house work and raising children.

Aval is involved in his own business to have an income for food. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. He has a good income from this business. The wife also helps Aval with the business by selling milk obtained from the livestock. Now Aval has several heads of livestock ready for sale and wants to increase his livestock headcount in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain this loan to buy livestock. Aval hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe BENKADI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de fruits et légume et de l’encens.
Les femmes du groupe BENKADI sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente AWA  première personne à partir de la gauche dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de fruits et légume. Elle compte acheter 1 gros panier de banane et de mangue sur place avec les grossistes à Dioïla. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle et parfois ambulante à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women, who are 39 years old on average and have around 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the municipality of Dioïla, which is in the Koulikoro  region (the second largest region in the Republic of Mali).  They met through family, neighbours and friends. They sell condiments, fruit and vegetables, and incense for a living. The Benkadi group women are on their first solidarity loan. In order to satisfy their customers' large demand, they are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. 
Awa, who is the first person on the left, standing up, did not attend school. She sells friend and vegetables for a living. She aims to purchase one large basket of bananas and mangoes from the wholesalers of Dioïla. Sales are made in cash at retail; she sells from her home and via door to door sales to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly revenue of 30,000 FCFA which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase food condiments

loans.name: 03-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Luyện has a service business tailoring clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. The main hardship that Luyện faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase a sewing machine to operate her sewing service.

Luyện is 34 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her 2 dependents. In 2012, Luyện joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Luyện is the group leader of the 03-Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 

With her business profit, Luyện hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine to operate her sewing service.

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr: Madame  Haby  est une promotrice qui évolue dans la commercialisation de tissus. Elle est âgée de 49ans, veuve  et mère de famille. Elle a 02 enfants dont le plus grand a 19 ans et le plus petit 17ans. C’est elle qui gère toutes les charges quotidiennes de sa famille et les frais de scolarité de ses enfants. Elle a une expérience de plus de 20ans. Elle demande ce crédit de ce montant pour acheter et vendre des tissus au  marché. Elle démarre sa journée à 8h pour la finir à 13h. Elle a choisi ce métier par amour. A l’avenir elle souhaite augmenter son stock de marchandises et ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de tissus. Ainsi elle pourra gagner beaucoup d’argent afin de pouvoir épargner de l’argent et prendre le monopole de la vente
texts.en: Mrs. Haby is a developer who works in the sale of textiles. She is 49 years old, a widow and mother. She has two children, the older child is 19 and the younger one 17 years old. She manages all the family expenses and her children’s school fees. She has over 20 years’ experience. She requests a loan for this amount to purchase textiles to sell at the market. She starts her day at 0800 and finishes at 1300. She chose this profession because she loves it. In the future she hopes to increase her stock of merchandise and to open a big shop selling fabrics. This would enable her to earn a lot of money which she would save up to take over the monopoly of the market.

loans.use: to buy textiles to sell to her potential customers.

loans.name: Sakim

texts.en:
Sakim, a 44-year-old woman, lives in a remote area of Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province with her husband and four unmarried children. She and her spouse farm a rice field located not far from their home, earning a daily income of USD 5.

This will be Sakim's second loan with HKL, which she will use to help pay for a motorbike, a purchase that will make her life a little more comfortable. She would like to expresse her thanks to all Kiva lenders in advance.

loans.use: to pay for a motorbike

loans.name: 05 - Quảng Hưng Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ngân works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future. She has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Ngân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

Ngân is 54 years old and she is married with 2 children. She lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. In 2013, Ngân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Ngân is the group leader of the 05 - Quảng Hưng solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Ngân hopes for her children to find a good job, to travel for vacation within the country, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase baby poultry to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 05 Thôn Thái Yên Xã Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Tịnh works in agriculture farming rice. She is applying for a loan to purchase more tools and rice seedlings to grow for future sale. Tịnh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital. This is Tịnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.

Tịnh is 50 years old and she is single with 3 children. She is the group leader of the Nhóm 05 thôn Thái Yên xã Công Chính solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. With her business profit, Tịnh hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and rice seedlings to grow for future sale.

loans.name: Nhóm 14 Thôn Thái Sơn 2 Công Chính Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ly works in agriculture raising livestock. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital. Ly is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future. 

In 2013, Ly joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Ly is the group leader of the Nhóm 14 thôn Thái Sơn 2 Công Chính solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. With her business profit, Ly hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 04-Phú Sơn2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyệt, a 60-year-old married mother of three, lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. She has been selling construction supplies for more than 10 years. Her main hardship is a lack of business capital.

In 2012, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  enterprise. Having borrowed and repaid three previous loans, she is now leading the 04-Phú Sơn2 solidarity group, which consists of four members, to request a new one. Nguyệt will use her portion to purchase more construction supplies to resell.


With her profits, Nguyệt hopes that her family will be healthy and happy, her enterprise will do well, and that she can build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more construction supplies to resell

loans.name: 01-Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tám operates a food stall/restaurant selling fruit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fruit to resell.

Tám is 53 years old and she is married with two children. She is the group leader of the 01-Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group, which consists of eight members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Tám joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Tám faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Tám hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more fruit to resell

loans.name: Sonia Ester

texts.es: Sonia de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella se dedica desde hace varios años a la venta y elaboración de tortillas su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene con ellos, Sonia esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal, para poder seguir con sus ventas y así poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Sonia is 39 years old. She lives in her own house with her family. She has been working for several years selling and making tortillas. Her business is located in her residence. She has a lot of customers because she offers good prices and she is very nice to them. 

Sonia is requesting the loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime. To be able to keep selling and to give her family a better quality of life without any limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal  and lime.

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DANAYA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 35 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Bolibana commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de l’habillement, de produit cosmétique et de jus.
Les femmes du groupe DANAYA sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOU  personne au milieu dans le rang des debout n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’habit. Elle compte acheter 10 puces de pagne wax chez les grossistes à Bamako. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce chez elle ainsi qu’au marché journalier  à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en: The Danaya group is made up of married women, who are 35 years old on average and have around 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the town of Dioïla, in the Bolibana quarter, in the Kaladougou area of the Dioïla prefecture, which is in the Koulikoro  region (the second largest region in the Republic of Mali).  They met through family, neighbours and friends. They sell condiments, clothes, cosmetics and juices for a living. The Danaya group women are on their fourteenth solidarity loan. In order to satisfy their customers' large demand, they are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso.  The amount requested will be used to purchase the types of merchandise already mentioned. Fatou, who is the lady in the middle of the ladies standing up, did not attend school. She sells clothing for a living. She aims to purchase 10 rolls of pagne (waxed cloths) from the wholesalers in Bamako. She will sell at retail for cash sales from her home and at the daily market, to a customer base made up of men and women. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 80,000 FCFA, which she will reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothing

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: En 2009, Akouvi  a débuté son activité en ouvrant son salon de coiffure dans le quartier Forever dans la belle ville de Lomé. Avec un enfant en charge, Akouvi est mariee.  Pour maximiser ses chances de revenus mensuels, Akouvi vend des mèches et des divers produits .Elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé. Avec ses efforts journaliers elle espère voir changer ses conditions de vie. Ce microcrédit de 500000FCFA  lui permettra de faire des achats de pagnes et de divers.
texts.en:
In 2009, Akouvi started a business by opening a hair salon in the Forever neighborhood in the lovely town of Lomé. With a child under her care, she is married.

To maximize her monthly earnings, Akouvi sells pagnes [brightly colored fabric], hair extensions and other goods. She procures her stock at the Lomé Grand Market.

With this daily work, she hopes to change her living conditions.

This micro-loan of 500,000 francs CFA will allow her to buy pagnes and other goods [to resell].

loans.use: to buy hair extensions, pagnes, and other products

loans.name: Jean Bosco

texts.en:
Jean Bosco is 32 years old. He is a father of three children.This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for construction of warehouse.

loans.name: Emerienne

texts.en:
Emerienne is 61 years old. She is married with six children. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. This Kiva loan will play a big role as a bridge for solving their primary day-to-day needs during that period.


The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). loans.use: To pay a for contruction of a warehouse/store for maize.

loans.name: 10-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thúy has a service business tailoring clothes; she has been involved in this business for two years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

Thúy is 35 years old and she is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with her two dependents.

In 2011, Thúy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thúy is the group leader of the 10-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth to sew and then sell clothes.

With her business profit, Thúy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sew clothes and sell them

loans.name: 04-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thịnh operates a food stall/restaurant selling liquor, beer, and snacks. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

Thịnh is 62 years old and she is married with five children.  Thịnh is the group leader of the 04-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2014, Thịnh joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thịnh has successfully repaid one loan from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Thịnh has been involved in her business for more than ten years.  The main hardship that Thịnh faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Thịnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to buy a motorbike.

loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks to resell.

loans.name: Tiessiri Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIESSIRI est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Bolibana commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments, de baigne et de savon.                                                           
Les femmes du groupe TIESSIRI sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire. Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
La cliente SALIMATA, première personne a partir de la droite  n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de beignet d’haricot. Elle compte acheter du beurre de karité, et 2 sacs de grains d’haricot sur place avec les grossistes à Dioïla, puis le transforme beignet de qualité. La vente se fait en espèce au marché journalier  à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The TIESSIRI group is made up of married women who are 44 years old on average, and have 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dioïla, in the Bolibana quarter, in the Kaladougou commune, which is in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali). 

They met through family, neighbours and friends. They make and sell food, condiments, fritters and soap. The Tiessiri group are on their fifth solidarity loan. In order to satisfy their customers' growing demand, they are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Salimata, the first person on the right, was not educated at school. She currently sells bean fritters. She aims to purchase shea butter and 2 bags of beans from the wholesalers of Dioïla; she will then transform these ingredients into good quality fritters. She sells her goods for cash at the daily market to a mixed customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for fritters

loans.name: Tugirijambo Group

texts.fr:
j.Marie fait partie du groupe Tugirijambo et  habite à Gitega. Elle a 47 ans et est mariée à  Emmanuel,  un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants, âgés de 3 à 15 ans.

Elle  fait le commerce des produits vivriers (riz, haricot,…) depuis  20 ans. 

Elle est à son huitième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter  son capital et acheter  beaucoup de kilos de riz et de haricot à revendre, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
J. Marie is a member of the Tugirijambo Group. She is 47 years old and married to Emmanuel, a trader. They live in Gitega with their six children, who are aged between three and 15 years old.

She has been selling foodstuffs (rice, beans...) for the past 20 years.

This is her eighth loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan, she will increase her capital and purchase several kilos of rice and beans, which will be resold at a profit

loans.use: to increase their capital and purchase several kilos of rice and beans, which will be resold at a profit

loans.name: 09-Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tiến works in agriculture raising fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby fish to raise and sell in the future.

Tiến is 37 years old and she is married with two children.  Tiến is the group leader of the 09-Nam Ngạn solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents.

This is Tiến's first loan with the Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Tiến has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Tiến faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Tiến hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby fish to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Colince

texts.fr: Colince is a Cameroonian aged thirty four married with three children the oldest is ten in primary school while the youngest is a month old. He has been in this business for over two years which makes him experience. His business is likely to succeed because it s located in an urban area with many potential customers. this loan will be use to increase his capital from one million two hundred thousand to one million three hundred and fifty thousand.
texts.en:
Colince is a Cameroonian, age 34; he is married and has three children.  The oldest is 10 and in primary school, while the youngest is a month old. 

He has been in this business for over two years, which makes him experienced. His business is likely to succeed because it is located in an urban area with many potential customers. 

This loan will be use to increase his capital from 1,200,000 to 1,350,000.

loans.use: To buy slaughtered pigs to fry and sell

loans.name: 0605 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Mrs Khoa operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat to resell

Khoa is 50 years old and she is married with three children.  Khoa is the group leader of the 0605 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of four members.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Khoa's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women.  Khoa has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  The main hardship that Khoa faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Khoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to resell.

loans.name: Dung

texts.en:
Dung is 54 years old, married, and has three children. She lives in Nong Cong district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province and works in agriculture raising poultry and cattle, which she has been doing for more than 10 years.

The main hardship Dung faces is not having a hygenic latrine. She requested her fifth loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women,  which she sill use to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom. With her business profit, Dung hopes her children find a good jobs, her business does well, and her family is healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, and bricks to build a toilet and bathroom

loans.name: 06 Phú Vượng Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell

Xuân is 28 years old and married with two children. She is the leader of a four-member group, the 06 Phú Vượng Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

This is Xuân's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Xuân has been involved in this business for two years. The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica doesn’t know the meaning of the word “quit”. After working for many years as a meter reader for San Diego Gas & Electric Company, Monica was forced to retire due to injuries sustained on the job. Faced with this setback, she turned adversity into opportunity by focusing on a passion she has held through her entire life: a love of art and animals.

In 1990, while shopping at her local California mall, Monica saw a kiosk selling t-shirts with dog images on them, and immediately her mind set to work on improving the designs. She expanded the idea to embroidered hats and eventually raised the capital to found her company, Animal as Art, in 2001 at the Irvine Spectrum shopping center. 

Reception was overwhelmingly positive, with her business immediately starting to attract buzz in the local dog-owner community. Monica particularly thrives on the interpersonal aspect of what she does.

“One of the things I like the most is to provide comfort to people who have lost their pet.  They are able to buy a t-shirt or hat with their deceased dog (breed) printed on them,” said Monica.  “If the picture does not look like their deceased dog, they bring me a picture and I draw their dog. I enjoy making pet owners happy and love to be among animals myself.”

Things were going well until the owners of the shopping mall raised the rent exorbitantly, and despite the undeniable quality of her product, Monica’s margins weren’t sufficient for her to keep the business above water.

Now that a few years have passed, Monica is hoping to restart her business and is looking for startup capital. Monica will use her $750 Kiva loan initially to purchase inventory and set up an online store to branch out from her local market to the online market, which would increase her pool of potential customers. 

Monica hopes that, with the help of generous Kiva donors, her business will become a real force for pet-ownership and animal rights in her local community as well as in the cyber community.

loans.use: to purchase inventory and set up an online store

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance is a 29-year-old mother of one, and businesswoman living in the Kwekwe district of Zimbabwe. She has been successfully practicing dressmaking for three months, now with assistance from her fellow Cama (Camfed’s alumni network) members. Constance is the secretary of her Cama chapter, and she assists girls at her nearby secondary school with guidance counseling sessions. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Constance plans to purchase a sewing machine, more uniform material and create employment for the people of her community. 

With the additional profits from her increase in uniform sales, she aims to supply schools in her district by opening her own uniform shop.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine and more uniform material.

loans.name: Nokuthula

texts.en:
Nokuthula, a young 18-year-old businesswoman living in the Lupane district of Zimbabwe, is looking for a Kiva loan to grow her men and women’s clothing business at a local flea market. 

She has been successfully running her business for the last six months, and would like to expand by purchasing larger amounts of clothes at lower costs from wholesalers. By doing this she will be able to drastically increase her profits. 

Nokuthula received business training from CAMA, Camfed’s alumni network, and knows what it takes to make a small business run smoothly. 

In her spare time, Nokuthula volunteers with local schools running awareness campaigns stressing the importance of an education. 

Nokuthula dreams of one day becoming a nurse, and would use her increase in profits to enroll herself into nursing school.

loans.use: to expand by purchasing larger amounts of clothes at lower costs from wholesalers.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, on top of being a successful businesswoman, is a 26-year-old mother of two living in the Kwekwe district of Zimbabwe. She volunteers her spare time delivering wellbeing and life skills session to students at the local schools. 

She has been operating a stall at the village flea market for eight months now, and would like to see it grow. 

With the requested Kiva loan, Elizabeth intends to expand her business by purchasing clothing in bulk from wholesalers at lower costs. 

This would enable her to sell the clothes at more favorable prices, and attract a higher number of customers. 

With increased profits, Elizabeth would like to meet the financial needs of her family and improve their standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing in bulk.

loans.name: Maa Gayatri Group

texts.en:
Hatibandha is a rural village situated 100 kilometers from the district Head Quarters of Nuapada in Odisha, India. After intervention of Mahashakti Foundation in early 2014, 10 active women came out to take a loan by forming a Self Help Group (SHG) named Maa Gayatri. 

Saraswati is one of the members. She is sitting with her hand raised in the photo. She is 46 years old and living with her husband, two sons and one daughter. Saraswati hails from a traditional cloth-weaving community. For the last 30 years, her family has been doing a cloth weaving business. Now she has two handlooms for weaving saris. Her husband purchases the yarn/thread from a town situated 40 kms away.  They prepare 80 to 100 pieces from a bundle of yarn, which costs around 10,000-15,000 rupees. Saraswati does the initial processing of the thread to make it ready for weaving and after that, her husband fits it to the handloom and weaves the sari. They only weave saris because of the demands of the market. Her family works around 8-10 hours a day and weaves one piece of sari on each handloom. Saraswati sells her products to the local traders on a weekly basis. She earns a monthly income of Rs. 6,000, which is not sufficient to maintain her family. With her present loan, Saraswati wants to buy thread/yarn in bulk. Purchasing more stock at a time will help her to reduce the purchasing and transportation costs of the raw material. Saraswati wishes to grow her business and save enough to complete the construction of her half-constructed house and give a better education to her children.

The other nine members of the SHG are doing various businesses like weaving, cloth selling, running a general store, a tent house and an electronics shop.

loans.use: To purchase a bundle of yarn for weaving saris

loans.name: Timinadia Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe TIMINADIA est composé de femmes mariées elles ont en moyenne 44 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent tous dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Dioïla, quartier Bolibana commune de Kaladougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de condiments et de fruits et légume.
Les femmes du groupe TIMINADIA sont à leur quatorzième prêt solidaire.
 Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente OUMOU, première personne a partir de la gauche n’est pas instruite, elle est actuellement vendeuse de jus. Elle compte acheter du sucre,  du sachet plastique, de bouteilles vides, et d’autre matière première sur place avec les grossistes à Dioïla, puis le transforme en jus de qualité. La vente se fait en détail et en espèce au marché journalier à une clientèle mixte. Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 20 000 FCFA qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
The TIMINADIA group is made up of married women who are 44 years old on average, and have 4 children each. They all live in traditional families in the village of Dioïla, in the Bolibana quarter, in the Kaladougou commune, which is in the Dioïla prefecture, in the Koulikoro region (the second largest administrative region in the Republic of Mali).
They met through family, neighbours and friends. They make and sell food, condiments, fruit and vegetables. The TIMANADIA group are on their fourteenth solidarity loan. In order to satisfy their customers' growing demand, they are seeking a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. Oumou, the first person on the left, was not educated at school. She currently sells juices for a living. She aims to purchase sugar, plastic sachets, empty bottles and other materials from the wholesalers of Dioïla; she will then transform these ingredients into good quality juices. She sells her goods for cash at the daily market to a mixed customer base. She aims to generate an average monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients in order to make juice

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy mobile phones for her business.

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Sal operates a farming business located in the Batheay District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been doing farming as her major source of income for nearly 15 years. She has her own land where she primarily grows rice and sells it in the local markets. Her business is going well. 

At this time, Sal is not able to plow the field by herself because of her bad health conditions. Therefore, she would like to propose a loan of USD 400 to hire some laborers to plow the field for her. She would like to expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to hire some laborers to plow her field

loans.name: San Martin De Yanahuara Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN MARTIN DE YANAHUARA, el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia Fernanda tiene 50 años de edad es casada y tiene 03 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, chachos entre otros, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose a este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a estos animalitos para luego venderlo a sus clientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.

La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes para su negocio.

La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.

La socia que sale en la foto adjunta pidió permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank San Martin de Yanahuara. The bank is located in the town of Urubamba in the Cusco region.

Fernanda is 50 years old, married, and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with the business of rearing small animals including guinea pigs and pigs, among others. She has had this business for a good while and its going well for her thanks to the effort she invests into her business every day. She rears these small animals in order to sell them later to customers that request them. She would like to be able to continue working to support her family in this manner.

The member requests this loan to buy guinea pigs for her business. She feels grateful for the granted loan and is committed to meeting the payments.

The member that appears in the adjacent photograph requested permission to arrive to the meeting late for work purposes.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs for her business

loans.name: Santa Clara De Urubamba Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA CLARA DE URUBAMBA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Teodora ella es conviviente y tiene 39 años y tiene 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta y crianza de animales, la socia cría los cuyes y gallinas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias y mercados, por medio de este pequeño negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cuyes y gallinas. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar cuyes y gallinas y alimentos para los cuyes y gallinas.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de comida, negocio de venta de animales, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de leche.



La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These are the members of communal bank “Santa Clara de Urubamba”. This communal bank is located in the district of Urubamba, province of Urubamba, department of Cusco.

Teodora, 39, is in a relationship and has four children. She works raising and selling guinea pigs and hens. When they are big and fat, she sells them at different fairs and marketplaces. Thanks to this small business, she is able to raise her children. Her dream is to have a place where she can sell her animals.

Teodora is requesting a loan to buy guinea pigs and hens, and feed for them. The remaining members sell food, animals, groceries and milk.

Teodora wants to thank all of those who are making part of her dream through this means and promises to pay the installments according to plan.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs and hens, and feed for them.

loans.name: Nhóm 01 Thôn 07 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Nở operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish, shrimp, and crabs. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish, shrimp, and crabs to resell. 

Nở is 43 years old and married with three children. Nở is the group leader of the Nhóm 01 Thôn 07 Quảng Dại solidarity group, which consists of six members. 

This is Nở's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nở has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Nở hopes to buy a motorbike, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish, shrimp, and crabs to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 02 Thôn 7 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Diễn has a stall selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase more fish to resell

Diễn is 43 years old and married with three children. Diễn is the group leader of the Nhóm 02 Thôn 7 Quảng Đại solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

This is Diễn's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Diễn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Diễn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn Thái Sơn Xã Thăng Bình Group

texts.en:
Lê works in a manufacturing business making iron and aluminum furniture. She is applying for a loan to purchase iron and aluminum material to make doors, windows and closets.

Lê is 24 years old and married with two children. Lê is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 Thôn Thái Sơn xã Thăng Bình solidarity group, which consists of four members. 

In 2009, Lê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lê has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Lê has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lê hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase iron and aluminum material to make doors, windows, and closets

loans.name: 49 Phú Hòa Hưng Lộc Group

texts.en:
Khuyên has a retail business selling pharmacy items. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pharmacy items to resell.

Khuyên is 43 years old and she is married with 2 children. She is the leader of a 4-member group, the 49 Phú Hòa Hưng Lộc solidarity group. 

In 2011, Khuyên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Khuyên has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Khuyên has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Khuyên faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Khuyên hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find good jobs, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase more pharmacy items to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand her business

loans.name: Azam

texts.ru:
Азам жизнерадостный и трудолюбивый мужчина  в возрасте 53 лет. Он женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Он обратился в Арванд впервые, когда узнал, что есть возможность получить финансовую поддержку.  Сам Азам живёт со своей семьёй в сельской местности. Он не имеет высшего образования, так как не было возможности учиться в Университете из-за финансовых трудностей в семье. Жена Азама также не имеет образования и является домохозяйкой, она занимается домашними делами и воспитанием детей.

Чтобы иметь доход на пропитание, Азам занимается своим бизнесом. Он занимается откормом и продажей крупного рогатого скота. Также Азам подрабатывает дехканином. Жена также помогает Азаму в его деле, она продаёт молоко, полученное от скота.  Сейчас Азам хочет увеличить количество скота для расширения своего бизнеса. Поэтому он обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку скота. Азам очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Azam is a happy and hardworking 53-year-old man. He is married and has 1 child. Azam comes to Arvand for the first time after learning about the opportunity to obtain financial support. Azam lives with his family in a rural area. He does not have higher education because he could not attend a university due to his family's financial hardships. Azam's wife also does not have higher education and is a homemaker, involved in house work and raising children.

Azam has his own business to have an income for food. He is involved in fattening up and selling cattle. He also works as a dekhan farmer. The wife also helps Azam with the business by selling milk obtained from the livestock. Now Azam wants to increase his livestock headcount in order to expand his business. This is why he came to Arvand and wants to obtain this loan to buy livestock. Azam hopes very much for a positive result and thanks Arvand for the support in advance.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Lima Group

texts.es: Irene tiene 60 años de edad es soltera y tiene a su cargo a su padre. Ella implemento su bodega en su vivienda al cual se dedica a sus 60 años. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más arroz azúcar aceite bebidas y golosinas. Su mayor deseo es implementar con papelería su bodega.  Ser socia del grupo “SANTA ROSA DE LIMA” le ha permitido mejorar su negocio y su economía. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Irene se encuentra parada viste casaca ploma.
texts.en:
Irene is 60 years old, is single and has her father in her care. She opened her small grocery store in her home, which she maintains at her sixty years. She will invest the loan in the purchase of more rice, sugar, cooking oil, drinks, and sweets. Her greatest wish is to sell stationary at her store. 

Being a partner  of the "SANTA ROSA DE LIMA" group has allowed her to improve her business and her finances. The group thanks the KIVA investors for offering the loan. Irene can be seen wearing a grey zip-up jacket.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, cooking oil, drinks and sweets.

loans.name: 020304060003- Quang Trung- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Minh works in agriculture raising poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Minh is 29 years old and she is married with 3 children. Minh is the group leader of the 020304060003- Quang Trung- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. Minh lives with 3 dependents in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Minh has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for 8 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Minh hopes for her business to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: 02030113003Đông Hải- Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Rắm works in agriculture farming poultry. She is requesting a loan to purchase more chicks to raise and sell in the future.

Rắm is 61 years old and she is married with 6 children. Rắm is the group leader of the 02030113003 Đông Hải- Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Rắm joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Rắm has successfully repaid 9 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Rắm has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Rắm faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Rắm hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nancy Damaris

texts.es: Doña Nancy, desde hace varios años se dedica a la actividad de venta de productos de uso domésticos como azúcar, arroz, carnes, Galletas, Verduras Jabón y otros productos variados para buscar el sustento de cada día, junto a su compañero de vida  han garantizado el bienestar familiar y el gastos de las clases de sus dos hijos que ahora estudian la secundaria y primaria respectivamente.   Solicita crédito para invertir en su negocio que desea surtir para ofertar variedad a sus clientes de esta manera obtener mayores ingresos y brindar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Doña Nancy for a few years has sold products for domestic use such as sugar, rice, meats, cookies, vegetables, soap, and other varied products to find sustenance very day. Along with her partner, they have guaranteed the well-being of their family and tuition for their two children that are in junior high school and elementary school. 

She requests this loan to invest in her business, which she would like to supply to offer a selection to her clientele and in this way gain more income and grant her family a better life.

loans.use: to buy tomatoes, cabbage, pork, beef, and chicken meat, among others

loans.name: 020303150003 Trung Hải-Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Hường works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Hường is 63 years old and she is married with 3 children. Hường is the group leader of the 020303150003 Trung Hải-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. Hường lives with one dependent in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2006, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hường has successfully repaid 8 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hường has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hường faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hường hopes to build a new house, to maintain  a successful business, and for her children to find good jobs.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Thôn 9 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Huường operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is applying for a loan to purchase fish to resell. 

She is 46 years old and married with three children. Huường is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Thôn 9 Quảng Dại solidarity group, which consists of five members. 

This is Huường's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Huường has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Huường hopes for her children to do well in school, for her business to do well, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: 0921. Thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga has a service business repairing motorcycles. She is requesting a loan to purchase instruments to maintain the motobike repair shop.

Nga is 41 years old, married, and has two children. Nga is the group leader of the 0921. Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Nga has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Nga has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main harship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase instruments to maintain the motobike repair shop.

loans.name: 0922.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Chúc works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Chúc is 63 years old and she is married with four children.  Chúc is the group leader of the 0922 Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of four members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Chúc joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chúc has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Chúc has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  The main hardship that Chúc faces in her business is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Chúc hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 0604.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Nga has a manufacturing business sewing clothes. She is requesting a loan to purchase more cloth to sew clothes and sell on.

Nga is 41 years old and she is married with two children.  Nga is the group leader of the 0604 Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members.   She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with two dependents

In 2012, Nga joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Nga has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Nga has been involved in her business for more than ten years.  The main hardship that Nga faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profits, Nga hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth to sew clothes and sell on.

loans.name: My

texts.en:
My is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new beverages to restock her stall. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increasing sales, and helping her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more beverages to stock her stall.

loans.name: 0923.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thảo operates a food stall/restaurant selling meat. She is requesting a loan to purchase more meat to resell.

Thảo is 44 years old and married with two children. She is the group leader of the 0923.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of five members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Thảo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. She has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thảo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thảo hopes to make enough money to provide for her kids, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat to resell

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Sang would like to take another loan to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods such as snack foods and confectionery to stock her general store. Sang's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan, she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy camel, sheep and goat skins for resale

loans.name: 0802.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs Bê works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future

Bê is 60 years old and she is married with one child.  Bê is the group leader of the 0802 Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Bê joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Bê has successfully repaid three loans from the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Bê has been involved in this business for more than ten years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is a lack of capital.

With her business profits, Bê hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more calves to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to repair his motorcycle so he doesn't have issues to go to work.

loans.name: Laura Marlene

texts.es: Laura tiene 30 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su hija de 4 años de edad. Laura se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas desde hace 4 años. Dicho negocio es el que le permite llevar el sustento a su hogar y dar dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Laura desea construir dos paredes para adecuar un cuarto para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de ladrillo, cemento, arena, puerta y ventana.
texts.en:
Laura is 30 years old and lives in her own home with her four year old daughter. Four years ago, Laura started making a living making and selling pupusas. Said business is the one that allows her to support her household and offer better living conditions to her family. 

Laura would like to build two walls to modify a room, for which she requests this loan from FUSAI, to invest in the purchase of brick, cement, sand, a door and a window.

loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, a door and window to build up two walls for a room.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 39 years old and is a farmer from Chibombo District, Zambia. She is asking for a loan to obtain a water pump that will help her irrigate and expand her vegetable crops.

Like many rural farmers in Zambia, Juliet currently uses buckets to draw water from a nearby river to irrigate her vegetable crops. This is an extremely tiring task, especially now that the dry season is starting. Last season, Juliet grew tomatoes, butternut squash and watermelons, which she sold at a large market in Zambia’s capital city, Lusaka. With the profits, she managed to purchase two cows and paid for her children’s school fees. She is hoping that a water pump will enable her to cultivate an even larger portion of land, and in turn bring in more profits.

Rent to Own has worked with Juliet to create a business plan for this year’s gardening season and will deliver a water pump directly to her farm. Rent to Own will also provide her with training on how to properly use and maintain the water pump, and will provide on-going support until she has completed her loan.

Juliet is confident that with a water pump her farm will continue to grow and support her family.

loans.use: to obtain a water pump for irrigation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a maize milling machine

loans.name: Brisa

texts.es:
Brisa esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo podrá comprar mercadería para su negocio de venta de ropa como short, polos, blusas, entre otros, con lo cual tendrá mayor variedad de productos para ofrecer y poder mejorar sus ingresos, ya que Brisa con el fruto de su trabajo como profesora y con su negocio de venta de ropa puede solventar los gastos de su hogar.

Brisa trabaja alrededor de 8 horas al día en su empleo como profesora y por las tardes ofrece los productos de su negocio de venta de ropa; Brisa trabaja mucho y es porque tiene un gran sueño:” Darle una buena educación a su hijo”.
texts.en:
Brisa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their support she will be able to purchase merchandise for her business, such as polo shirts, shorts, blouses and other items.  She will have a greater variety of products to offer and will be able to increase her income.  She also works as a teacher, and with the added income from this business she is able to meet her household expenses.

She works around 8 hours per day in her job as a teacher, and in the afternoons she runs her clothing business.  She works very hard, because her greatest dream is to provide her son with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for resale, such as polo shirts, shorts, blouses and other items.

loans.name: Gervacio Regis

texts.es:
Gervacio es un hombre trabajador, tiene 54 años de edad y vive en Ica junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos.
Desde hace más de 4 años trabaja como Ayudante de Maestro de Obras y le va muy bien porque es una persona muy responsable y emprendedora. También se dedica a la distribución de cerveza desde hace más de 1 año.
Tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante por eso siempre trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
Gervacio está agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar más mercadería para poder implementar en su negocio y de esta manera pueda contar con más ingresos y ahorrando dinero poder cumplir su más grande sueño: "Terminar de construir su vivienda".
texts.en:
Gervacio is a hardworking 54-year-old man.  He lives in Ica with his wife and their two children.

Four over for years he has worked as an assistant art teacher, and things are going very well since he is a very responsible and enterprising person. He also has been distributing beer for over one year.

He is highly motivated to get ahead, and for this reason he always works with a great deal of effort so that he can provide his family with a better quality of life.

Gervacio is grateful to the Kiva lenders, since with their support he will be able to purchase more merchandise for his business, which will lead to higher income.  He will then be able to save money so he can fulfill his greatest dream, which is to finish building his home.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise to supply his business.

loans.name: Philippe

texts.en:
Philippe is 32 years old. He is the father of four children. He has spent 12 years farming maize. This is a new loan product from Urwego Opportunity Bank (UOB) which will help in the construction of the warehouse or store for their maize produce while they are waiting for their harvest to be bought by the buyers. This constructed infrastructure will even help the entire community to have a secure store for their produce in the future. UOB’s farmer clients are benefiting from production financing which is significantly increasing their yield or production; however, during the post-harvest processes, they are suffering from lack of income as they have to wait for the buyer to pay them. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for construction of a warehouse/store for maize produce.

loans.name: Benkelema 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe BENKELEMA  4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konona, un des villages de la commune de Dambela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur sixième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Assatou debout au milieu. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte  des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marché des SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 175.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the group called Benkelema  4 are married women with an average age of 43 and on average, four children, and all live in polygamous families in Konona, one of the villages of the community of Dambela in the third administrative region of Mali, Sikasso. 

They collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to succeed in their agricultural activities during this rainy season. They are on their sixth loan with the institution, the prior loans having been correctly reimbursed. The crop cultivated is maize in the case of Assatou, standing in the middle. With her loan she expects to buy farm inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare. The produce is sold right in the village, in the markets of Sikasso, after the harvest, to a clientele composed of men and women. 

Assatou expects to make a profit of 175,000 F CFA per season. This profit will permit her to repay her loan and also to help her husband with daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and seeds

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJANTOYERELA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 41 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warasala commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales, de condiments, de charbon et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leurs vingt cinquième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MADIO, personne au milieu dans le rang des debout est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle compte acheter 90 sacs de charbon de bois sur place avec les femmes du village. La vente se fait en gros et en espèce chez elle uniquement a ses clients venus de Bamako. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000Fcfa, qui sera investie dans l’élevage de caprin.
texts.en:
The Djantoyerela group  is composed of married women averaging 41 years of age, with five children. They all live in traditional families in the village of Warasala in the township of Gueégnéka, prefecture of Diola, Koulikoro region (the second administrative district of Mali). 
They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They work selling cereals, condiments, charcoal and miscellaneous items. The group members are on their 25th solidarity loan. They collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to meet very high customer demand. The loan will be used to buy the goods mentioned above. Our client Madio, the one standing in the middle in the photo, is illiterate. She currently works selling charcoal. She plans to buy 90 bags of charcoal locally from women in her village. She sells wholesale, for cash, out of her home, to buyers who especially come to her from Bamako. 
She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which she will invest in raising goats.

loans.use: to buy charcoal.

loans.name: 020303210003  Trung Hải-Hoằng Thanh Group

texts.en:
Hoàn works in agriculture raising pigs. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Hoàn is 53 years old and she is married with 3 children. Hoàn is the group leader of the 020303210003 Trung Hải-Hoằng Thanh solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. Hoàn lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2012, Hoàn joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hoàn has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hoàn has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hoàn faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hoàn hopes for her children to find good jobs, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Dimbaly Diabote Group

texts.fr: DIMBALY DIABOTE est un groupement de femmes qui est composé de 5 personnes. Elles vivent ensembles dans le même quartier et font la même activité. Fatou est leur présidente, c’est elle qui a levé la main sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Elle évolue dans la commercialisation de l’huile de palme et a une expérience de plus de 5 ans dans cette activité. Elle n’a pas de charges particulières et démarre sa journée à 8h pour la terminer à 16h. Elle demande se montant pour aller en Casamance acheter de l’huile de palme en quantité et le revend en détail dans le marché de sa commune. A l’avenir elle voudrait diversifier ses marchandises et augmenter ses revenus. Ainsi elle pourra gagner d’avantages de clients.
texts.en: DIMBALY DIABOTE is a women's group comprising five members.  The members of the group live in the same neighborhood and are involved in the same activity.  The group's president, Fatou, is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is married and has a family.  She sells palm oil and has more than five years of experience in her field of work.  She has no major expenses and works from 8 AM until 4 PM.  She is requesting this loan to go to the Casamance region of Senegal and buy large quantities of palm oil, which she will resell on a retail basis at her local market.  In the future, she would like to diversify her merchandise and increase her income, in order to expand her customer base.

loans.use: to buy palm oil for resale at the market.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJIGUISSEME est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans la ville de Fana, quartier Guégneka commune de Guégneka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce céréales, de condiments et de poisson. Les femmes du groupe DJIGUISSEME sont à leur quinzième prêt solidaire.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente DJENEBA, deuxième personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de condiments. Elle compte acheter du sel, 2 panier de tomate, 1 carton de cube Maggi et du l’ail sur  avec les grossistes de Fana. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 21 000Fcfa, qui sera réinvesti dans son activité.
texts.en:
Djiguisseme Group is made up of married women who, on average, are 39 years old and have four children. They all live in traditional families in the town of Fana, in the Guégneka neighborhood commune within the Dioïla prefecture in the Koulikoro region (second administrative region of the Republic of Mali).
