The group members met through family, neighborhood, and friendship ties. They sell grains, spices, and fish. The women of Djiguisseme Group are on their 15th group loan. With the goal of meeting enormous demand from their customers, they turn to Soro Yiriwaso. The [loan] amount will be used to purchase the goods noted [above and below].

Djeneba, the client second from the left [in the photo] is illiterate and is currently selling vegetables and spices. She plans to purchase salt, two baskets of tomatoes, one box of Maggi [bouillon] cubes, and garlic from the wholesalers in Fana. Her retail sales are made for cash from her home to a group of male and female customers. Djeneba expects to see a monthly profit of 21,000 CFA francs, which will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices.

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette, 34, is married and has three children. She has been in the business of maize production for more than ten years.  

Jeannette is requesting a Kiva loan on behalf of her group to construct a warehouse for maize farmers to store their produce before it is purchased. The warehouse will be used by all of maize farmer clients that lives near the community . The warehouse will help minimize damage to the maize crop that occurs post-harvest.  This will help them sell more of their crop yield. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to construct a warehouse to store maize

loans.name: Kartierton 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe     KARTIERTON 2 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 47 ans, 5 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Siaka Zegué debout à l’extrême droite sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 500.000 francs FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members in the Kartierton 2 group are married men who, on average, are 47 years old and have five children. They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, one of the towns of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities in the rainy season.

Siaka Zegué, who is standing on the right right of the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to farm three hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and in Sikasso to customers who are mostly retailers coming from the large towns.

Siaka Zegué hopes to earn an average profit of 500,000 francs CFA per harvest.

Earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and help his large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Phoeun

texts.en:
Phoeun, a 57-year-old, lives and operates a farming business which is located in Batheay District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been farming as her major source of income for nearly twenty years. She has her own land where she primarily grows rice and sells it in the local markets. Her business is going well. 

During this time, Phoeun is lacking money to support her farming business. Therefore, she would like to propose a loan in the amount of KHR 1,000,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides. She would like to express her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Kankeletigui 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  KANKELETIGUI 3 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Dembela, chef lieu de la commune de Dembela dans la 3ème région administrative du Mali : SIKASSO.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur septième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Awa deuxième assise de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter  des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village et à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 170.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the KANKELETIGUI 3 group are married women who, on average, are 43 years old with 4 children each.  They all live in polygamous families in Dembela, the main town in the commune of Dembela, in the Sikasso region  (third administrative region of Mali).

These women have joined the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.  They are now on their seventh loan with the institution and have duly repaid all their previous loans.

Awa, a member of the group, grows maize.  In the photo, she is the second woman seated from the right.  She plans to use her loan to buy fertilizers and seeds to cultivate one hectare of land.  After the harvest, she sells her production to both men and women, in Sikasso and in her village.  She is expecting to make an average profit of 170,000 CFA francs per planting season.  Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and to help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

loans.name: Thou

texts.en:
Thou, a 39-year-old married man, lives and operates a farming business which is located in Batheay District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has been farming as his major source of income for nearly twenty years. He has his own land where he primarily grows rice and sells it in the local markets. This business allows him to make USD 7 per day.

During this time, Thou is lacking money to support his farming business. Therefore, he would like to propose a loan in the amount of USD 500 to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticide. Thou would like to express his thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticide

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe DJEKAFO est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 51 ans et 4enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WARASSALA commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de céréales de grains de dah et de charbon. Les femmes du groupe DJEKAFO sont à leurs vingt cinquième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente MAMA , deuxième personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de grains de dah. Elle compte acheter 4 sacs de grains de dah les chez grossistes au marché hebdomadaire. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce chez elle à et au marché des villages environnants à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The Djekafo Group is made up of married women with an average age of 51 and an average of four children each. They all live within traditional family frameworks in the village of Warassala, Guégnéka Commume, Dioïla Prefecture, Koulikoro Region, the second administrative region of the Republic of Mali. They all know each other through the bonds of family, community and friendship. They sell cereals, dried hibiscus flowers and charcoal.
This will be the twenty-fifth loan for the women of the Djekafo Group. In order to satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they have turned to Soro Yiriwaso. The requested loan amount will go towards the aforementioned merchandise. Mama, the woman standing second from the left in the photo, is illiterate. She currently sells dried hibiscus flowers. She plans on buying four sacks of dried hibiscus flowers from the wholesalers at the weekly market. She sells her stock for cash out of her own home and at the markets of the surrounding villages to a mixed customer base. She plans on making a monthly profit of 70,000 FCFA, which will be used to cover her family's daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase dried hibiscus flowers

loans.name: Kartierton 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les  membres du groupe     KARTIERTON 4 sont des hommes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, 6 enfants et vivant tous dans des  familles traditionnelles à Nimprodioula, un des villages de Sikasso, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec  Zoumana debout à l’extrême gauche sur la photo; il  compte acheter avec son prêt, des intrants, la semence et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de Sikasso après la récolte à une clientèle composée essentiellement de revendeurs venant des grandes villes. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 750.000 francs FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi aider la grande famille dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kartierton 4 group are married men who, on average, are 48 years old and have six children. They all live in traditional families in Nimprodioula, one of the villages in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season.

Zoumana, who is standing on the far left in the photo, grows corn. With his loan, he plans to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor to farm four hectares of land.

After the harvest, crops are sold in the village and at markets in Sikasso to customers who are mostly resellers coming from the large villages.

Zoumana hopes to earn an average profit of 750,000 francs CFA per harvest. 

These earnings will allow him to pay back his loan and also help his large family with their daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm inputs and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase over the counter medication.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en:
Sina, 54 years old, lives in Batheay District, Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She is a Khmer noodle seller in the market near her house. She has been running this type of business for more than ten years. The benefit that she can get from her business is USD 3 per day that she uses for supporting her three children.

Sina has already built a small house, but she still lacks money to pay for suitable stairs and some appliances. Therefore, she would like to propose a loan in the amount of KHR 3,000,000 to buy stairs and equipment for her new house. 

She would like to express her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy stairs and equipment for her house.

loans.name: Antonia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Señora Antonia se dedica al comercio, venta de tortillas actividad que realiza hace 10 años  siendo sus principales clientes las personas de su barrio, su negocio lo atiende de manera personal todos los días de la semana, atiende todos los días desde muy temprano su negocio.
Doña Antonia sueña con tener más clientes, para obtener más ingresos para mejorar su nivel de vida familiar, ella está solicitando el crédito para la compra de Maíz, cal, leña, frijol.
Doña Antonia espera con estos recursos mejorar sus ingresos ya que necesita capital para producir más tortillas.

Danlí, Honduras – Mayo  2014
texts.en:
Antonia has been selling tortillas for ten years.  Her main customers are the people in her neighborhood.  She personally tends to her business every day of the week.  She tends to her business every day, and she starts very early.

Antonia dreams of having more customers in order to get more income to improve her family’s standard of living.  She is requesting the loan to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and beans.  Antonio hopes that with these resources she will improve her income.  She needs capital to produce more tortillas.

Danlí, Honduras – May, 2014

loans.use: to buy corn, lime powder, firewood, and beans.

loans.name: Nhóm 11 Cụm 4.5 Thôn 4 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liên works in agriculture, raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Liên faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Liên is 34 years old and married with three dependent children. She lives and works in Quang Xuong district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Liên is the group leader of the Nhóm 11 Cụm 4.5 Thôn 4 Quảng Nhân Solidarity Group, which consists of five members. 

In 2003, Liên joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Liên has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Liên hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 1302 Đông Vệ Group

texts.en:
Hà works in agriculture farming rice. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tools and fertilizer to farm and sell rice.

Hà is 44 years old and she is married with 2 children. Hà is the group leader of the 1302 Đông Vệ solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Hà joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Hà has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Hà has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Hà faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Hà hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more tools and fertilizer to farm and sell rice

loans.name: Nhóm 03 Thôn 02 Quảng Đại Group

texts.en:
Thủy operates a stall selling vegetables and fruit. She  is applying for a loan to purchase more vegetables and fruit to resell.

Thủy is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children. Thủy is the group leader of the Nhóm 03 thôn 02 quảng đại solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 

In 2013, Thủy joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Thủy has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Thủy has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.

In the future, Thủy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables and fruit to resell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: pay for tuition and books.

loans.name: Tubogorane Group

texts.fr:
J. Marie fait partie du groupe Tubogorane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Il  a 36 ans  et est marié  à Désiderata, une commerçante. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 8   à 13  ans dont 4 étudient.

Il fait le commerce de poissons (ndagala)  depuis  4 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit Kiva  qu’il obtient, il va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de poissons (ndagala) à revendre   pour gagner plus.

Dans les années prochaines, il voudrait faire de l’élevage comme deuxième activité   et  voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
J. Marie is a member of the Tubogorane group and lives in Bujumbura. He is 36 years old and is married to a Désiderata, a merchant. Together they have five children, aged from eight to 13 years old. Four of the children go to school.

J. Marie has been selling fish (ndagala) for four years. This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva-financed loan, he is going to increase his capital and buy a large amount of fish (ndagala) to resell and earn more.

In the coming years, he would like to start a second business raising and selling animals. He would also like to see his children [continue to] go to school.

loans.use: to buy a large amount of fish (ndagala) to resell

loans.name: Hong's Group

texts.en: Hong is 53 years old and lives with her children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. For the past 12 years Hong has been running a food stall in front of her house to sell noodles with beef. She is the group leader of a three-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is wearing a white blouse and pants. Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Hong is requesting a loan to purchase better quality noodles and beef to make soup for selling at her food stall. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy noodles and beef

loans.name: Noelia Rosa

texts.es:
Noelia es una joven luchadora, es soltera, tiene 25 años de edad y vive en el Departamento de Arequipa junto a sus padres.
Es una mujer con muchas ganas de salir adelante, estudió la carrera de Secretariado Computarizado en un Instituto de la zona donde reside.
Actualmente trabaja como Auxiliar Administrativo en una prestigiosa empresa donde le va muy bien porque es muy responsable y dedicada al trabajo. También se dedica a la producción y comercialización del cultivo de Papa y otras variedades de Hortalizas que los ofrece en el mercado a un precio al alcance de todos
Noelia está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado ella podrá realizar un sostenimiento del cultivo de "papa", así como complementar los gastos de control Fitosanitario del cultivo para obtener productos de mejor calidad y poder competir con empresas más grandes. Así con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación logrará cumplir su más grande sueño: "Establecer su propia empresa donde el cultivo de la "papa" obtenga un valor agregado y pueda ofrecerlo al mercado internacional".
texts.en:
Noelia is a hardworking young woman. She is single, 25 years old, and lives in Arequipa with her parents. She is eager to get ahead, and studied Computerized Secretarial studies in a school in her area.

She is currently working as an Administrative Assistant in a prestigious company, where she is doing very well due to her responsibility and dedication to her work. She also works farming and selling potatoes and other vegetables that she sells in the market at a reasonable price.

Noelia is grateful to Kiva lenders because with the support they have given her, she is able to maintain her potato crops, and supplement costs of Phytosanitary control for better quality products, which enable her to compete with larger companies. With a lot of effort and dedication, she will be able to fulfill her greatest dream: to establish her own business where farming the potato is highly valued and which she can offer to the international market.

loans.use: to maintain her potato crop and achieve Phytosanitary control.

loans.name: Pudak Sari Wangi Group

texts.en:
The Pudak Sari Wangi group located in West of Bali. This group borrowed 7.500.000 IDR of loan and they can pay it off on time. The repayment represented by the head of the group, Ni Luh.
Ni Luh told us that the development of her pig business is running well. Before the loan, she only had 3 pigs and now because of the loan she has 5 pigs. Each pig grew fast and healthy. She sold the pigs after 2 months to pay off the loan. She also set aside for saving and to meet her family's daily needs. All the members of Pudak Sari Wangi feel the benefits from this business. They can support their husband's income. The group expects more training from MUK to improve their knowledge of pig breeding.
Entering the fourth loan, most of the member of Pudak Sari Wangi group have a sow and local pigs for pig barbecues. The local pigs will sell every two months.
As the head, Ni Luh sets a good example for her friends. Now she plans to purchase 5 super quality piglets for fattening. She’s really happy and thankful to Kiva, MUK and lenders for supporting her business and also the group. Now she can support her children education needs.

loans.use: to purchase 5 super quality piglets

loans.name: Serieux Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SÉRIEUX est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 42 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WARASSALA commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font, le commerce céréales, condiments, et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe SÉRIEUX sont à leurs vingt deuxième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA , première personne à partir de la gauche est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de mil. Elle compte achèter 7 sacs de mil sur place dans le village et ses environs. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 70 000Fcfa, qui sera s dans l’élevage de caprins.
texts.en:
The group SÉRIEUX is composed of married women, who average 42 years of age and four children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of WARASSALA, in Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in grains, condiments, and general goods. 

The women of the group SÉRIEUX are on their 22nd solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, FATOUMATA, who is the first person from the left, is uneducated. She is currently a vendor of millet. She intends to purchase 7 sacks of millet locally in and around the village. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash. She plans on making a monthly profit of 70,000 francs CFA that will be used for raising goats.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cabbage, tomatoes, onions, and meats.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase cosmetic products.

loans.name: Yeang

texts.en:
Yeang, 56 years old, lives and operates a farming business which is located in Batheay District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been farming as her major source of income for nearly twenty years at which she can make USD 2.5. She has her own land where she primarily grows rice and sells into the local markets. 

During this time, Yeang doesn't have enough money to support her farming supplies. Therefore, she would like to propose a loan, which is the first loan for her with KIVA, in the amount of KHR 1,500,000 to buy seeds, fertilizer ans insecticide. She would like to expresses her thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: 0407.thiệu Trung Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Lượt works in agriculture, raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Lượt is 54 years old and she is married, with three children. She is the group leader of the 0407.Thiệu Trung solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2003, Lượt joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Lượt has successfully repaid one loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. Lượt has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Lượt faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Lượt hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 6 Cụm 2.12 Thôn 2 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diệp works in agriculture, raising pigs. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that Diệp faces in her business is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

Diệp is 51 years old and married with one child. She lives with no dependents in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

Diệp is the group leader of the Nhóm 6 Cụm 2.12 Thôn 2 Quảng Nhân Solidarity Group, which consists of four members. In 2008, Diệp joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Diệp has successfully repaid one loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Diệp hopes for her business to do well, to maintain a successful business, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase more baby pigs to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: Nhóm 8 Cụm 2.12 Thôn 2 Quảng Nhân Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Phương, who is a 27-year-old married mother of three, lives with her family in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has been working in agriculture raising cattle for the last five years. Her main hardship is a lack of capital. 

In 2010, Phương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business and has fully repaid her previous loan. Now the leader of the Nhóm 8 cụm 2.12 Thôn 2 Quảng Nhân solidarity group, which consists of four members, Phương is requesting a group loan. She will use her portion to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

With her profits, Phương hopes to ensure her business does well so that she can make enough money to provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and sell in future

loans.name: 0603.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chút has a retail business selling dry food. She is requesting a loan to by more dry food  ( salt, beans, peanuts,...) to resell

Chút is 61 years old and she is married with 1 child.
Chút is the group leader of the 0603.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of 5 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province

In 2011, Chút joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chút has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Chút has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship Chút faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chút hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to by more dry food  (salt, beans, peanuts,...) to resell

loans.name: 02040129 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Liệu operates a food stall/restaurant selling fish. She is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to resell.

Liệu is 36 years old and she is married with 2 children.
Liệu is the group leader of the 02040129 Giang Sơn - Hoằng Trường  solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with 2 dependents

In 2011, Liệu joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Liệu has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Liệu has been involved in this business for 8 years.
The main harship that Liệu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Liệu hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to resell

loans.name: 0303.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Ms. Chẻo works in agriculture raising cattle. She is requesting a loan to purchase more baby cattle to raise and resell the in future


Chẻo is 64 years old and she is single with no children.
Chẻo is the group leader of the 0303.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 4 members. 
She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with no dependents

In 2011, Chẻo joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Chẻo has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
Chẻo has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.
The main hardship that Chẻo faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Chẻo hopes to maintain  a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more baby cattle to raise and resell in the future

loans.name: Sreyoun

texts.en:
Sreyoun is 24 years old. She is a student who lives in Kratie Province, Cambodia. Due to the lack of financial support, she would like to apply for a loan of $1,400 USD to pay her tuition fee. 

This loan will help her to get a higher education. In the future, Sreyoun hopes that she can be a staff member of a Non-Governmental Organization.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fee.

loans.name: Elsa Zenovia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia Elsa  tiene 54 años de edad  es casada y tiene 02 hijos, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de elaboración de tortas, la socia elabora a pedido para los distintos compromisos que solicitan sus servicios como matrimonios,bautizos,fiesta de 15 años entre otros,, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio él cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia a la vez trabaja en una empresa privada, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como harina, mantequilla entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Elsa is a member of the communal bank Velasco Astete.  She is 54 years old, is married and has two children.  She divides her time between working for a private company and running her tortilla-making business.  She makes the tortillas on order for events such as marriages, baptisms and 15-Year-Old parties. She enjoys her work, and business is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day.

She wishes to be able to continue working and continue supporting her family.  She is seeking this loan in order to purchase supplies such as flour and butter.  She is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as flour and butter.

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Cándida  de 30  años de edad  es  madre soltera  y vive con su hijo de cuatro año de edad en su casa de habitación donde cuenta con una pequeña  pulpería sus clientes son la mayoría de los alumnos del colegio de la zona ya que la prefieren por ser una persona muy amable y luchadora, ella radica en el municipio de san Isidro Choluteca al sur.
 Cándida está solicitando 7, 000.00 lempiras para surtir en mas en  refrescos, churros, manteca, confites, chicles, papel, azúcar, maíz y otros productos,  Y Con las ganancias y el apoyo de este préstamo desea mejora mas el  mismo.
Su sueño es tener sus negocios mas surtido para tener una mejor condición de vida.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo2014
texts.en:
Cándida is a 30 year-old single mother who lives with her 4 year-old son in her home where she has a small grocery store. The majority of her clients are students in the school in her area, who prefer her for her friendly and hardworking personality. She lives in the municipality of San Isidro Choluteca in the south.

Cándida is requesting a loan of 7,000 lempiras to stock more soft drinks, churros, butter, candy, gum, paper, sugar, corn, and other products. She wants to improve herself and her store with the profits and support of this loan.

Her dream is to have a business with more products and variety so that she can have a better quality of life.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, churros, butter, candy, gum, paper, sugar, corn, and other products for her store.

loans.name: Segundo Rufino

texts.es: Don Segundo es una persona reconocido en la zona, con sacrificios ha establecido su propio negocio ante la necesidad de obtener sus propios recursos, vende maíz, frijoles, azúcar, arroz, y mas productos de consumo básico, tiene la necesidad de invertir para surtir el negocio y con sus ingresos no es suficiente por lo que solicita crédito para esta inversión,  su esposa le ayuda en las actividades diarias del negocio, todos sus hijos son mayores de edad y no depende de él.  Su mayor propósito es ver su negocio amplio y surtido para ir ahorrando para su vejez y resolver alguna necesidad que se les presente a sus hijos ya que ha sido un padre responsable y quiere lo mejor para ellos.
texts.en: Don Segundo is well known in the neighborhood.  He's made many sacrifices to build his retail business, but his hard work has paid off.  He sells maize, beans, sugar, rice and other everyday products. He is applying for a loan that he will use to stock his business and says that he wouldn't be able to raise the funds he needs without your help.  Don Segundo's wife helps him with the business.  Their children are grown and no longer living at home.  Don Segundo wants to grow his business and save for retirement.  He would like to help his children, as well, because he's a responsible father and wants the best for them.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Laidou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAIDOU est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de Warassala commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments, de de fruits et légume et d’article divers. Les femmes du groupe LAIDOU sont à leurs vingt cinquième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FATOUMATA  deuxième personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse d’article divers. Elle compte acheter 2 sacs de sucre, 2 carton de thé, 3 cartouches de cigarette 1 carton de Lipton et des sachets plastique de chez les grossistes à Bamako La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce chez elle dans son étale à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 45 000Fcfa, qui sera investie dans l’élevage de caprin.
texts.en:
The group LAIDOU is composed of married women, who average 38 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of WARASSALA, in Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they do commerce in condiments, fruit & vegetables, and general goods. 

The women of the group LAIDOU are on their 25th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, FATOUMATA, who is the second person from the right, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of a variety of merchandise. She intends to purchase 2 sacks of sugar, a box of tea, 3 cartons of cigarettes, a box of Lipton, and some plastic bags from wholesalers in Bamako. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at a display at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 45,000 francs CFA that will be used for investing in raising goats.

loans.use: to purchase various goods to resell

loans.name: Sabougnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe SABOUGNOUMA est composé de femmes mariées, elles ont en moyenne 34 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles dans le village de WARASSALA commune de Guégnéka, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font la restauration, le commerce de charbon et de la farine boulangère. Les femmes du groupe SABOUGNOUMA sont à leurs vingt cinquième prêts solidaires.
Dans le but de satisfaire la demande énorme de leurs clientèles, elles font recours à SORO YIRIWASO.
Ces montants seront utilisés pour acheter leurs marchandises déjà citées.
La cliente FANTA SOMA , première personne à partir de la droite est analphabète, elle est actuellement vendeuse de farine boulangère. Elle compte acheter  5 sacs de farine et des sachets plastiques les chez grossistes à Fana. La vente se fait en détaille et en espèce chez elle à une clientèle mixte. Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000Fcfa, qui sera utilisé pour couvrir les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The group SABOUGNOUMA is composed of married women, who average 34 years of age and three children each. All the women live in traditional families in the village of WARASSALA, in Commune de Guégnéka, Préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of kinship, community, and friendship. And they work in food service and do commerce in charcoal and baker’s flour. 

The women of the group SABOUGNOUMA are on their 25th solidarity loan. To satisfy the enormous demand from their customers, they turn to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. These funds will be used to purchase their merchandise as cited above. 

This client, FANTA SOMA, who is the first person from the right, is illiterate. She is currently a vendor of baker’s flour. She intends to purchase 5 sacks of flour and some plastic bags from wholesalers in Fana. Her sales are made at the retail level to a mixed customer base paying with cash at her home. She plans on making a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used for cover the family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase flour to resell

loans.name: Narean

texts.en: Narean is 19 years old. She is a student who lives in Kratie Province, Cambodia. Due to the lack of financial support, she would like to apply for loan of $1,400 to pay for her tuition fee. This loan will help her get a higher education. In the future, Narean hopes that she can be a staff member of a Non-Governmental Organization.

loans.use: To pay for her tuition fee

loans.name: 1212.tt Vạn Hà Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Oanh has a retail business, selling papers. She is requesting a loan to purchase more papers to sell. Oanh is 49 years old and she is married, with one child.

Oanh is the group leader of the 1212.TT Vạn Hà solidarity group, which consists of five members. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2011, Oanh joined the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women to improve her business. Oanh has successfully repaid four loans from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women. She has been involved in this business for more than ten years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Oanh hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more papers to sell.

loans.name: 0909.thiệu Dương 16 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Thành operates a food stall/restaurant where she sells fruit, and is requesting a loan to buy more items to sell. She is 29 years old, married and the mother of two children. She also leads the 0909.Thiệu Dương 16 solidarity group, which consists of four members, and lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province, with her family. In 2013, she joined the Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business, and has successfully repaid two loans from the fund. She has been in her current line of work for three years and says that one of her biggest difficulties is a lack of capital. With the profits she earns, Thành hopes to maintain  a successful business and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to resell

loans.name: 03.thiệu Phúc Group

texts.en:
Vân works in agriculture raising cattle. Vân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Vân faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase cattle to raise and sell in the future.

Vân is 43 years old, married, and has 3 children and 3 dependents.  She is the group leader of the 03.Thiệu Phúc solidarity group, which consists of 3 members. 
She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a  rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Vân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Vân has successfully repaid 1 loan from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Vân hopes to make enough money to provide for her children, have business do well, and buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase cattle to raise and sell in the future.

loans.name: 021306040002- Hiệp Thành - Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Xuân lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Xuân is 41 years old, married, and has 2 children. 

Xuân operates a food stall/restaurant selling noodles. Xuân has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Xuân faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to make noodles to sell.

 She is the group leader of the 021306040002- Hiệp Thành - Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.   In 2013, Xuân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Xuân has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

With her business profit, Xuân hopes for her business to do well, to build a new house, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make noodles to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase the biodigesters for resale

loans.name: 03 Đông Hải Group

texts.en:
Hường is 36 years old, married, and has 2 children.

Hường operates a food stall/restaurant to sell meat. Hường has been involved in this business for 3 years.  One of the most critical business difficulties that concerns her is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to purchase more meat to sell.

She is the group leader of the 03 Đông Hải solidarity group, which consists of 6 members. In 2004, Hường joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Hường has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

In the future, Hường hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, her children to do well in school, and her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase meat to resell.

loans.name: Wasara Wasara Group

texts.en:
Patience is a member of the Wasara Wasara group. She is a 43 year old widow who is hardworking and highly motivated in her work. Patience and four other women in her community came together and formed this group when they realised they needed to take their businesses to a higher level. These women are highly focused and have been meeting every week for the past two months to discuss and find solutions as to how they can grow their small businesses. Most of them are widows so they are the sole providers for their children.
Patience runs a fruit and vegetable stall which is by the roadside. On this stall a few groceries such as sugar, rice and cooking oil are also found. She has been running this stall for two years now, from the time her husband passed on. A loan of USD1,350.00 from Kiva, combined with the strong will that these women possess will definitely yield positive results for them.

loans.use: To buy groceries and other goods for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase equipment to start a catering business.

loans.name: Kotognogontala  C Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe  Kotognogontala  C  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 43 ans, 4 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à Konzanso, un des villages de la commune Urbaine de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali : 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur quatrième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est  le maïs avec Salimata assise à la deuxième position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants et de semences agricoles pour entretenir  1 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, aux marchés de SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 105.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Kotognogontala C group are married women who on average are 43 years old with four children. They all live in polygamous families in Konzanso, one of the villages in the Sikasso municipality, in the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fourth loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been repaid in full.

The selected crop is maize featuring Salimata, who is sitting in the second position from right to left in the picture. She will use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds to maintain one hectare (about 2.47 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level in the markets of Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit.

She expects to make an average profit of 105,000 CFA francs per growing season. This profit will enable her to pay off the loan, and also help her husband with daily expenses

loans.use: buy agricultural inputs and seeds

loans.name: Chhang

texts.en:
Chhang, a 34-year-old and married man, lives and operates a farm which is located in the Batheay District of Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. He has one child who is a student in a local school. Farming, which is the main source of his income, allows him to make $3.00 USD a day to support his family.

HIs earnings through farming are a little bit low; he would like to borrow $1000.00 to buy a motorbike and become a motorbike taxi driver to supplement his income. 

Chhang would like to express his thanks to all lenders in advance.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Sidy

texts.fr: Monsieur SIDY est un coiffeur de profession, il est célibataire et n’a pas d’enfants. Il a une expérience de 5 ans dans le métier et voudrait ce crédit pour acheter du matériel d’exploitation. A part ses charges de ses parents, il n’a pas de charges particulières. Il démarre sa journée à 9h pour la terminer à 21h. Il voudrait à l’avenir avoir 03 autres salons de coiffures et satisfaire ses clients. Grace à l’aide de l’institution, il souhaite augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie de ses parents et fonder une famille.
texts.en: Mr. SIDY is a barber by trade. He is unmarried and has no children. He has five years of experience in this work and would like this loan to purchase some supplies and equipment for it. Aside from his parents’ expenses, he has no particular expenses. His day starts at 9 AM and ends at 9 PM. For the future, he would like to have three other barbershops and to satisfy his customers. Thanks to the microfinance institution’s help, he would like to increase his revenues and improve his parents’ living conditions, as well as start a family.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and equipment for his work in a barber shop

loans.name: 02 Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Lân operates a food stall/restaurant to sell rice and noodle. Lân has been involved in this business for 5 years.  In 2009, Lân joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Lân has successfully repaid 6 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Lân is the group leader of the 02 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of 3 members.    She requests a loan to purchase ingredients to make noodles to sell.

Lân is 51 years old, married, and has 3 children with no dependents.  She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.







With her business profit, Lân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to find a good job, and for her business to do well.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make noodles to sell.

loans.name: Hieu's Group

texts.en:
Hieu, a 30-year-old married woman, lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She has one daughter. 

She supports her family by running a food stall. She is a Group leader of an 8-member loan group and lives in Ho Chi Minh city.  She is pictured standing in the back row, second from the left wearing a white T shirt.  

Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. 

Hieu requests a loan to expand her business by buying a larger variety and bulk quantities of soft-drinks to sell from her food stall. This will enable her to offer a better range of products to her customers. She hopes that her business will run smoothly, she can earn additional income, reinvest in her stall, and save for emergencies.

loans.use: to buy a variety and bulk quantities of soft-drinks.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal VELASCO ASTETE, la socia Verónica  tiene 21 años de edad  y es conviviente la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurante, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio él cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día, la socia elabora diferentes tipos de platos como arroz con pollo,  saltado ,sopas entre otros para todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta manera seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos como carne, aceite entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Verónica is a member of the communal bank Velasco Astete. She is 21 years old and lives with her common-law husband.

She spends her days running a restaurant. She makes various dishes such as rice with chicken, salted meats and soups for her customers. She enjoys her work, and business is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day. She wishes to be able to continue working and supporting her family. 

She is seeking this loan in order to purchase supplies such as meat and oil. She is grateful for the loan opportunity and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as meat and oil.

loans.name: 021306040002 Thôn 7 _ Hoằng Kim Group

texts.en:
Huương has a retail business selling dry food. Huương has been involved in this business for more than 10 years.  The main hardship that Huương faces in her business is the lack of capital.  She requests a loan to to purchase salt, beans, and peanuts.

Huương is 59 years old, married, and has 2 children.  Huương lives  in Hoang Hoa district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2013, Huương joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her  business. Huương has successfully repaid 2 loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Huương is the group leader of the 021306040002 Thôn 7_ Hoằng Kim solidarity group, which consists of 7 members. 

In the future, Huương hopes for her business to do well, her children to find good jobs, and her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase salt, beans, and peanuts.

loans.name: Samvel

texts.en:
Samvel is 49 years old. He has a higher military education and for 17 years he worked as a contractual military serviceman. Now he works at a school as a teacher of military skills. Samvel is married and he lives with his family in Vanadzor city in Lori region. His wife works as a librarian. They have a son and he works as a machinist. For many years Samvel saved money which he planned to spend on repairing his house, but still the amount of money is too little to repair the whole house.

He is asking for a loan of 500,000 Armenian drams in order to repair the bathroom which, as you can see, is in very poor condition now. He thanks his lenders beforehand and he already dreams of the day that the bathroom of his house will be nice and clean.

loans.use: to repair his bathroom which  is in very poor condition now

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet requests a new loan to buy hairdressing tools and items to satisfy her customers' needs. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, grow in capacity, and increase sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her business, her income, and  help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing tools and items to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu requests a new loan  to buy a greater quantity and variety of new products, such as sugar, cooking oil, and seasonings to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her to  increase the size of her store, increase sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity and variety of new products to restock her general store.

loans.name: Hien

texts.en: Hien is requesting a new loan to buy oil steaming machine, hair tools and shampoos to better satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business, processing capacity and sales. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business and increase her income, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy oil steaming machine, hair tools and shampoos to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh requests a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers.

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store, increase sales, and  help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products to restock her general store.

loans.name: Wilber Enrique

texts.es:
Wilber, estudio hasta octavo ciclo en idiomas, en la UTEC  y dejo el estudio, ya que se le hizo difícil continuar, por su situación económica, tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, vive con una hermana y otros familiares.


Wilber sea dedicado al negocio de especias, todos los días a las 6 de la mañana sale a vender a varios cantones y colonias, va en su motocicleta de tienda en tienda, el trabajo lo aprendió con una hermana. El crédito anterior le sirvio muchisimo, para surtir su venta y esta vez quiere ofrecer mayor cantidad y variedad a sus clientes.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO,  es para comprar especias, curtidos, dulces y otros productos. Con esto podrá vender mayores cantidades a sus clientes, lo que ayudara a mejorar su situación económica.


Wilber sueña con ahorrar para continuar su estudio lo antes posible y graduarse de la universidad.
texts.en:
Wilber studied languages at UTEC but left early because he couldn't afford to go on.  He has a 2-year old daughter and lives with his sister and other relatives.


Wilber makes a living selling spices.  He starts at 6 every morning, going from store to store on his motorcycle.  His sister taught him the business.  He used a loan before to stock his business with a wider range of products and says the investment helped him grow the business.


Wilber is applying for a CREDICAMPO loan that he will use to stock his business with spices and other products.  The investment will allow him to sell larger lots of his products to his customers and help him build the business further.


Wilber's great hope is to go back to school and complete his studies.

loans.use: to stock his retail business.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
Rosa de 50 años de edad, estudio 6 grado, esta casada y tiene 3 hijos uno de 27 años de edad que trabaja y otro de 25 años de edad que esta estudiando cuarto año de laboratorio clínico en la universidad y la ultima de 20 años que ya no estudia para ayudar en el negocio.


Rosa vende cereales y pupusas en un puesto del mercado desde hace 25 años, negocio que aprendió por la necesidad de alimentar a sus hijos. Todos los días a las 6:00 am  viaja 45 minutos en bus hasta el lugar de trabajo donde permanece todo el día.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO  es para comprar maíz, quesillo, chicharrones, aceite, frijoles, cereales. Para surtir su negocio  lo que ayudara a mantener los insumos que sus clientes le buscan, así estará segura de tener ingresos para el estudio de su hijo y comida de la familia.

Rosa sueña con viajar a estados unidos a conocer algunas ciudades y ayudar a su hijo para que se gradué como profesional.
texts.en:
Rosa, 50 years old, went to school through the sixth grade. She is married and has three children. One is 27 years old and working, the next is 25 years old and is in the fourth year of clinical laboratory studies at the university, and the last one is 20 years old and doesn't go to school in order to help with the business.

Rosa has been selling grains and stuffed tortillas from a stall at the market for 25 years. It is a business that she learned out of necessity for taking care of her children. Every day, at 6 am, she travels 45 minutes by bus to the place where she works, and she stays there all day.

The loan she is requesting from Kiva partner Credicampo is to purchase corn, cream cheese, pork rinds, oil, beans, and grains. This is to stock her business, which will help her have on hand the supplies her customers are looking for. This way, she will be sure to have income for her son's schooling and food for the family.

Rosa dreams of traveling to the United States to visit some cities as well as of helping her son so he can graduate and become a professional.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cream cheese, pork rinds, oil, beans, and grains.

loans.name: Tarika

texts.en: Previously, Tarika purchased inventory for her fast-food restaurant, and this time she needs to make some repairs to the same place. The amount she is requesting is 100,000 Albanian Lek.

loans.use: To make repairs to her fast food restaurant.

loans.name: Mimishack Group

texts.en:
Susan is a lady aged 29. She is a mother of two and married to a teacher. Susan is a member of Mimishack (translated as Expansion) group, which is a five member group. They got their first loan from Thrive when Susan was operating a vegetable and fruits roadside stall. She is amongst one of the members of the group who really benefited from previous loan since she managed to develop from a stall to a flea market where she is now selling clothes and shoes from South Africa. She managed to acquire a passport which she is now using for travelling legally to South Africa for restocking, at a time when the business environment is harsh in Zimbabwe Susan appreciates the opportunity the loan provides for her. 

Mimishack group is applying for $1900 loan from Thrive and Susan wants to use her portion to acquire more stock from South Africa especially winter wear and blankets. The loan will not only have an impact on business, it also positively influences their households and improves their standards of living.

loans.use: To buy winter wear and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Be Forward Group

texts.en:
Marian is a 37 year old married mother of two children. She lives in Kambuzuma, Harare, Zimbabwe. Marian's business has been mainly buying and selling goods,  focusing on clothing materials, specifically shoes/footwear.  Marian gets her stock from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC).
Enterprising Marian heard about the opportunities offered at Thrive and enrolled for a loan and business training to complement her hard work. Marian says her previous loan from Thrive benefited her immensely as she now has ventured into another lucrative line of business. Marian has also added selling of pulling socks (pantyhose) to nurses, targeting up market medical institutions in Harare. Her notable clients are Rock foundation, Avenues Clinic, Westend Hospital, Baines Avenue Clinic among others. Marianne gets her stocks of pantyhose from South Africa.
Marian wishes to further her business and to be able to stock in larger quantities from the producers of the pulling socks (pantyhose). Marianne’s success in business has seen her being able to complement her husband financially in the household. She has been able to attain financial security and retain some savings.

loans.use: To buy and sell pantyhose to nurses and other health professionals.

loans.name: Chazezesa Group

texts.en:
Maggret is the Chairperson of Chazezesa group which is located in the Kuwadzana high density suburb in Harare. She is a mother of six and is aged 46.  Her husband operates a hardware shop in the same area.  Maggret rears broiler chickens in the back yard of her house and she has a fowl run with a capacity of 300 birds. Currently she has in her fowl run 2 batches of 75 birds each, so she has capacity to expand with further funding.  

Their group is full of potential  with members having a lot of  energy for their respective businesses. Their loan requirement is $2,100.  This amount will take them a long way as it will improve and grow their businesses. The loan will not only have an impact on business, it also positively influences their households as they complement their personal lives. The women view these loans as a chance to attain financial security and sustainability. Maggret requires $500 to increase her working capital to increase the number of birds she rears per batch.

loans.use: To rear more chickens for sale.

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en: Fetije is the mother of seven children, living in an Ashakli community. Her husband receives social support and assistance but they are still very poor and live in substandard living conditions. As part of a way to make even a small amount of money to help, she works with her sons transporting different items (in the picture with one of her sons) and iron with her small transportation vehicle. However she is requesting a loan to purchase a cultivator for her transportation needs. This loan will help her to work more efficiently and with much more ease, therefore supplying her family with more income. She would like to thank all of the lenders for making her work easier and giving her the opportunity to support her family better.

loans.use: to purchase a cultivator for transportation needs

loans.name: Shahlo

texts.ru: Шахло живет и работает в городе Душанбе. Она молодая замужняя женщина в возрасте 29 лет, имеет двух детей. Ее муж работает в государственном учреждении. Сама Шахло хотя и имеет высшее образование, но не работает по специальности. Она в течение трех лет занимается швейным делом и шьет женские национальные платья. Шахло сейчас занята обставлением дома. Она нуждается в кредите для приобретения удобной мебели. Шахло хочет улучшить бытовые условия, но без кредита ей не осуществить планы. Она надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en: Shahlo is a young lady who lives and works in the city of Dushanbe.  She is 29, married and has two children.  Her husband has a government job.  Shahlo herself has a university education, but her job isn't related to her major; she works as a seamstress, making Tajikistani women's clothing for a living, and has been doing so for 3 years already.  Currently, Shahlo is seeking to buy new furniture for her house; she wants to make her home more livable, but can't go ahead with her plans unless she gets a loan.  She is counting on you for financial support.

loans.use: buy new furniture for her home

loans.name: Nyetaa Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Nyetaa vivent toutes dans des familles nucléaires. Elles ont en moyenne 38 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le quartier de Sebougou de  Ségou (4ème Région administrative de la République du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté, mariage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu dans le quartier. Elles font le petit commerce d’encens, d’habillement et produit cosmétiques. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur  1er cycle du prêt solidaire.
 Madame Youma (la 2eme femme assise de la gauche vers la droite dans la photo) est une grande vendeuse d’encens dans le quartier et ses environnants. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 20 bouteilles d’encens aux marchés de Ségou et Bamako. La vente se fait au comptant et souvent à crédit à la maison, dans le marché et en ambulant à  une clientèle mixte.
 Madame Youma espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen  de 20 000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera utilisé pour prendre en charge une partie de la famille et augmenter également  son fonds de commerce.
texts.en:
The four women who make up the Nyetaa group all live in monogamous families. On average, they are 38 years old and have five children each. They all live in Sebougou, a neighborhood of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through neighborhood, family and marriage ties and also through their income-generating activities in the neighborhood. They are involved in small retail and they sell incense, clothes and cosmetics.  In order to increase their businesses, they have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso, and this is their first cycle of solidarity loan.

Youma (second from the left in the photo) is an important seller of  incense, in and around the neighborhood. She is planning to use her loan to buy 20 bottles of incense at the Ségou and Bamako markets.  She resells her  merchandise for cash and also often on credit, from her home, at the market, and also as an itinerant seller. She sells to both men and women. Thanks to this loan, she is hoping to make an average monthly profit of 20,000 CFA francs which will be used to cover some her family's expenses and also to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy some incense.

loans.name: Jantoyerela  2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe JANTOYERELA  2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 48 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur SIDI débout à la deuxième position de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme JANTOYERELA  2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 16 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 30 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  4 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 280.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jantoyerela 2 group are married men who on average are 48 years old with seven children, mostly living in traditional families in Niantanso, a village in the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth maize-growing loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been fully repaid.

The crop grown is maize featuring Mr. Sidi, standing in the second position from the left to the right in the photo of this Jantoyerela 2 group of men. He intends to use the loan to buy 16 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 30 cans of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for tilling to maintain four hectares (about 10 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. He expects to achieve an average profit of 280,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to pay off part of the loan and interest, and on the other hand help with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Janeth Del Socorro

texts.es: Janeth es una señora humilde quien hace poco fue víctima de robo en su casa de habitación del cual  se está reponiendo poco a poco, tiene bajo su cargo a dos hijos estudiantes de secundaria, Janeth solicita el crédito para continuar alimentando su negocio invirtiendo con mas productos como ropa de segunda para ofrecer a sus clientes, así garantizar la manutención de su familia.
texts.en: Janeth was the victim of a robbery recently and is only now recovering from it.  She has two school-aged children.  Janeth is applying for a loan that she will use to stock her used clothing business.  The investment will allow her to offer a wider range of products to her customers and, in turn, better support her family.

loans.use: to stock her used clothing business.

loans.name: Sinignessigui 4 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI 4 sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 35 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à LOBOUGOULA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur huitième prêt de campagne avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec madame MARIAM assise à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe de femme   SINIGNESSIGUI 4. 
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter 1 sac de 50 kg d’engrais, 1 bidon d’herbicide, payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,25 hectare. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 74 000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The five members of the Sinignessigui 4 group are married women who, on average, are 35 years old and have four children. They mostly live in traditional families in Lobougoula, an area in Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali. The group members are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to better carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth loan, and their previous loans have all been repaid correctly.

Mariam, seated first from the right in the photo, grows corn. With her loan, she plans to buy one 50-kilogram sac of fertilizer and one drum of herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor to farm a 1/4 hectare of land.

After the harvest, crops will be sold in the village and in Sikasso to male and female customers for cash and credit.

Mariam hopes to earn an average profit of 74,000 francs CFA per harvest. These earnings will allow her to pay back her loan and also help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and herbicide, and to pay the cost of labor

loans.name: Wassa Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe WASSA sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 32 ans et ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart  dans des  familles traditionnelles à KOUMANKOU un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur quatrième prêt de production de maïs  avec l’institution de microfinance soro yiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est : de maïs  avec monsieur LASSINA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme WASSA. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 12 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 25 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente et payer les frais de labour  pour entretenir : 3 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SIKASSO à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  300 000 FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer d’une part son prêt et son intérêt et d’autre part de contribuer  les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the group WASSA are married men who average 32 years of age and 5 children each. Most of them live in traditional families in KOUMANKOU, a village located in the Sikasso circle (3rd administrative region of Mali). 

They joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso to sustain their farming activities during the rainy season. This is their 4th collaboration with the MFI. All past loans were correctly repaid.  

Mr. LASSINA grows maize. He is the member standing in the center of the group photo. He will use his loan to buy 12 50-kg sacks of fertilizer and 25 jugs of various grades of herbicide, and to pay for the plowing needed to maintain 3 hectares of farmland. 

After the harvest, the crops will be sold in the village at the Sikasso market, cash or credit, to a clientele consisting of both men and women. 

Mr. Lassina expects to earn an average profit of 300,000 FCFA per campaign, which will allow him to repay his loan and the interest, and also to cover part of his family’s day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, inputs and herbicides, and to cover the cost of plowing.

loans.name: Cinthia Mabel

texts.es:
La joven Cinthia de 23  años de edad, vive con su conyugue,   tiene   dos hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa de familiar, radica en la comunidad  de el jícaro galán, Valle al sur de Honduras, y se dedica desde hace 4 ½ años  al negocio de la venta de ropa nueva, su venta es de forma ambulante  ella  es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante, pues sale a pie a vender en los barrios y colonias de el jícaro, Nacaome, ella visita a sus clientes.
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de varias docenas de ropa nueva y sandalias. Con el apoyo de este préstamo ella  mejorara sus ingresos y por ende su calidad de vida, está contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma y Kiva, y su deseo es tener buen surtido de ropa para esta época de invierno es su quinto préstamo que solicita.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - Mayo del 2014.
texts.en:
Cinthia, 23, is an enterprising young woman.  She is partnered and has two young children.  The family lives in the rural town of El Jicaro Galan in southern Honduras.  Cinthia has worked as a street vendor, selling clothing for 4 1/2 years.  She sells in El Jicaro Galan, Nacaome and surrounding towns.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to buy stocks of new clothing and footwear.  She says that the investment will allow her to increase her income and improve her quality of life.  She wants to go on working with Prisma and Kiva and plans to buy winter clothing with this, her fifth loan.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - May 2014.

loans.use: to stock her clothing sales business.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh is 42 years old and divorced.  She lives with one son in a small house in Ho Chi Minh city. She earns an income selling cakes.  She is also a motor taxi-driver and takes students to and from school in her local community. She began these jobs four years ago. 

Linh intends to take a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of cakes to sell and to repair her motorcycle. She hopes that the loan will help her to satisfy her customers and increase her income. 

She hopes that her business will run smoothly and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy cakes to sell and repair her motorcycle.

loans.name: Jasmin

texts.es:
