Jasmin es una joven emprendedora, tiene 19 años de edad, soltera, vive en el Distrito de San Vicente junto a su familia.
Desde hace más de 1 año trabaja en los Campos Agrícolas de la zona donde vive, le va muy bien porque es una persona que tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y a su corta edad es muy trabajadora y busca mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, luchando con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación.
Una de las metas de Jasmin es poner una bodega para poder obtener otros ingresos y remodelar su vivienda, es por ello que ella está muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar mercadería para implementar el negocio ya que a la fecha cuenta con los andamios y el mostrador, solo falta comprar la mercadería, pero gracias a Kiva podrá cumplir su sueño: "Tener su propio negocio". Gracias Kiva
texts.en:
Jasmin, 19, is an enterprising young woman.  She is single and lives with her family in the San Vicente neighborhood.  
She has worked for Campos Agricolas for more than a year and says it's going well because she works hard and wants to get ahead.  She's young, but wants to help her family.  
One of Jasmin's goals is to open a corner shop.  A business of her own would give her an income and allow her to help her family improve their house.  Jasmin says that she is grateful to Kiva lenders for their help because she will be able to use their loan to buy the merchandise she needs to start.  She has already installed a counter and shelving and only needs products to sell.  Thanks to Kiva, she will able to fulfill her dream: "To have my own business".  Thanks, Kiva.

loans.use: to open a general store.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Loan is requesting a new loan. She will use it to buy clothing materials for making clothes to sell. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

Loan hopes that her new loan will assist her to increase the size of her store, increase sales, and also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy clothing materials for making clothes to sell

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is requesting a new loan to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials to make jute-bags. Lan's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Lan also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and sewing materials to make jute-bags

loans.name: Oanh

texts.en: Oanh is requesting a new loan to buy carton materials for producing carton containers. Oanh's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers, and increase her sales. Oanh also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy carton materials for producing carton containers

loans.name: Xuyen

texts.en:
Xuyen, 44, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a bricklayer. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

Xuyen started this business five years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. 

She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular, food and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

Xuyen hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Carlos Vladimir

texts.es:
Carlos de 38 años de edad, estudio segundo año de bachillerato, esta casado, su esposa ayuda en la elaboración de pan de su negocio, sus hijos de 13 y 18 años estudian, y el ultimo tiene 2 años.

Carlos tiene 12 años de experiencia con su panadería, oficio que aprendió, asistiendo a talleres o capacitaciones sobre panadería, el pan lo elaboran por la mañana y por la tarde él, su esposa, y sus padres venden en la parada de buses.

El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO  es para comprar harina, azúcar y otros productos para la panadería, también realizara algunas mejoras a su casa.


Carlos sueña con abrir un local en la ciudad, para ampliar la venta de pan y  tener mas ingresos y  brindarle el  estudio a sus hijos y tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carlos, 38 years old, went to school through the second year of his bachelors degree. He is married, and his wife helps make bread for his business. Their children are 13 and 18 years old. They go to school. The little one is two years old.

Carlos has 12 years of experience with his bread bakery, a trade that he learned by going to shops or trainings about bread. He and his wife make the bread in the morning and in the afternoon, and his parents sell it at bus stops.

The loan he is requesting from Kiva partner Credicampo is to purchase flour, sugar, and other items needed for baking bread. It is also for some home improvements.

Carlos dreams of opening a shop in his town in order to increase bread sales and have more income for his children's education and for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and other products for baking bread, as well as for making some home improvements.

loans.name: Emilio De Jesús

texts.es:
Emilio de 58 años de edad,  estudio hasta séptimo grado,  esta casado y tiene 3 hijos, los cuales viven de forma independiente, su esposa ayuda en la economía familiar criando cerdos y pollos de engorde.


Emilio tiene 20 años de experiencia en el manejo de ganado de repasto, oficio que aprendió con su papá,  ya que esta era la única actividad productiva que hacían para subsistir.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO  es para comprar 4 vacas de engorde en repasto.  Con esto podrá conseguir alguna ganancia para la comida de su grupo familiar.


Emilio sueña con tener 3 vacas lecheras para obtener su alimento diario y vender otra parte para obtener dinero y ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio, 58 years old, went to school through seventh grade. He is married and has three children who are all living on their own. His wife helps with the family business of raising and fattening pigs and chickens.

Emilio has 20 years of experience in raising and fattening up livestock, a trade that he learned from his father because this was the only economic activity that they could do to survive.

The loan that he is requesting from Kiva partner Credicampo is to purchase four cows for fattening. With this, he will be able to earn some money for his family to have food.

Emilio dreams of having three dairy cows for his daily milk consumption, and he would sell the rest to make money and help his family.

loans.use: to purchase for cows to fatten up.

loans.name: Jantoyerela  3 Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe JANTOYERELA  3 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39 ans, ont en moyenne 5 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur cinquième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur LAMINE débout à la première position de la droite vers la gauche sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme JANTOYERELA  3. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 12 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 20 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  3 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 208.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jantoyerela 3 group are married men who on average are 39 years old with five children, mostly living in traditional families in Niantanso, a village in the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They work with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their fifth maize-growing loan with the institution, and all previous loans have been fully repaid.

The crop grown is maize featuring Mr. Lamine, standing in the first position from right to left in the photo of this Jantoyerela 3 group of men. He intends to use the loan to buy 12 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 20 cans of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for tilling to maintain three hectares (about 7.4 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. He expects to achieve an average profit of 280,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to pay off part of the loan and interest, and on the other hand help with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Sumber Mulia Group

texts.en:
The Sumber Mulia group successfully repaid 5 previous loans. During the loan period, they raised the disease-free, healthy pigs. The pigs are fed nutritious feed and vitamins.

Ketut sold her local pigs and earned a good profit. She also sells piglets in her village. She’s very happy with the results. Her husband and family  benefit. The children attend school and their daily needs are fulfilled. 

She thanks the lenders, Kiva, and MUK for supporting her business.

The Sumber Mulia group decided to continue their  loan with MUK. They still need the loan to increase their business and they will stop after they all have enough capital to run the business themselves. They request a higher loan amount.

Ketut will use her loan to purchase 2 piglets. To reduce the cost, she uses a mix feed made from fish. Ketut works at the fish ponds and takes a dead fish to home to use it for pig feed. 

She hopes that during the next 5 months, the pigs will be healthy and earn a satisfactory price. The profit will be used to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 superior piglets

loans.name: Jiguisseme 2 Group

texts.fr:
Les 5 membres du groupe JIGUISSEME 2 sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 29 ans, ont en moyenne 4 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à KOLOKOBA  une commune dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Ils sont à leur deuxième prêt de production de maïs avec l’institution de microfinance soroyiriwaso, les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec monsieur YACOUBA débout au milieu sur la photo dans ce groupe d’homme JIGUISSEME 2. 
Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 12 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 15 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 145.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The five members of the Jiguisseme 2 group are married men who on average are 29 years old with four children, mostly living in traditional families in Kolokoba, a district in the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second maize-growing loan cycle with the institution, and the previous loan has been repaid in full.

The selected crop is maize featuring Mr. Yacouba, standing in the middle in the photo of this Jantoyerela 2 group of men. He intends to use the loan to buy twelve 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 15 cans of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for tilling to maintain two hectares (about 5 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. He expects to achieve an average profit of 145,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to pay off part of the loan and interest, and on the other hand help with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for tilling

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es: María tiene 46 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su esposo  y su hijo de 8 años de edad quien se encuentra estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. María tiene 5 años de dedicarse a la venta de huevos y joyería de enchape. La venta la realiza de forma ambulante y gracias a su experiencia y buenos precios ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. María solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado que desea invertir en la reparación del techo de la vivienda dado que actualmente se encuentra deteriorado. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en: María is 46 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and eight-year-old son. The son is going to public school in their town. Maria has been selling eggs and costume jewelry for five years. She does traveling sales, and thanks to her experience and good prices, she has a lot of customers who always choose her first. Maria is requesting a loan from Kiva partner FUSAI because she wants to invest in repairing the roof on her house. The one she has now is deteriorating. With the requested money, she will purchase galvanized metal, wood, and nails.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized metal, wood, and nails for repairing the roof on her house.

loans.name: Jantoyerela  B Group

texts.fr:

loans.name: Jantoyerela  C Group

texts.fr:
Les 4 membres du groupe JANTOYERELA  C sont des hommes mariés  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 41 ans, ont en moyenne 7 enfants et vivant la plupart dans des familles traditionnelles à NIANTANSO un village dans le cercle de SIKASSO 3ème région administrative du MALI.
Ils collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage.

Avec son prêt, il compte acheter 10 sacs de 50 kg d’engrais, 17 bidons d’herbicide de qualité différente , payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  2,5 hectares. 
Après la récolte la production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes au comptant et à crédit.
Il compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 205.000 francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra d’une part de payer son prêt et son interêt d’autre part de contribuer dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The four members of the Jantoyerela C group are married men who on average are 41 years old with seven children, mostly living in traditional families in Niantanso, a village in the circle of Sikasso, the third administrative region of Mali.

They have been working with the Soro Yiriwaso micro-finance institution to carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their eighth maize-growing loan cycle with the institution, and all previous loans have been fully repaid.

The selected crop is maize featuring Mr. Diakalia, standing in the second position from right to left in the photo of this Jantoyerela C group of men. He intends to use the loan to buy ten 50-kilo bags of fertilizer, 17 cans of different kinds of herbicide, and pay for tilling to maintain two and a half hectares (about 6.18 acres).

After harvest the crop is sold at village level and in Sikasso, to a clientele composed of men and women, for cash and on credit. He expects to achieve an average profit of 205,000 CFA francs per growing season.

This profit will enable him to pay off part of the loan and interest, and on the other hand help with the family's daily expenses.

loans.use: buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pay for tilling

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, and lime for her business.

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Cuc is a 50-year-old single woman who has sewn clothes for 30 years. 

Cuc is the Group Leader of an 8-member loan group and lives in Ho Chi Minh City. She is pictured standing third from the right, wearing a white jacket and flowered slacks. Each of the group members request loans to fund income-generating activities.

Cuc requests a loan to purchase cloth and sewing materials to make clothing. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties.

loans.use: to buy cloth and sewing materials.

loans.name: Nhanh

texts.en:
Nhanh requests a new loan. She will use it to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her store, increase sales, and help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to sell in her store.

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang, 61, is widowed and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She earns an income running a general store in front of her house. 

She started this business eight years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 51, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn an income running a general store in front of their house. 

She started this business 14 years ago. She sells sugar, toys for kids, soft drinks, yogurt, and other household items to people in her community. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store and better satisfy her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth lives in Kampala. She is married with 3 children and all her children go to school.  She also cares for additional family members (brother’s son). She sells fruits and vegetables. She operates her business at the market. She has been in business for the last 3 years. She works six days a week.  She has requested for a loan of Ugandan shillings of 200,000 to buy onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cow peas, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes. Her business challenge includes thieves and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to become a wholesaler and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expense includes rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy onions, cabbages, cassava, fresh beans, cow peas, tomatoes, and sweet potatoes

loans.name: 0803.thiệu Khánh Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Minh operates a food stall/restaurant selling vegetables. She is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables to resell

Minh is 40 years old and she is married with three children. Minh is the group leader of the 0803.Thiệu Khánh solidarity group, which consists of three members. She lives and works in the Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in the Thanh Hoa province, with three dependents.

In 2011, Minh joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. Minh has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.

Minh has been involved in this business for more than 10 years. The main hardship that Minh faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a 51-year-old mother from the Kakamega region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Jackson, who is a farmer and supports the family. She supports five people in her family and was blessed with three children who are all adults, aged 23, 20 and 16 years old respectively.

She has a tailoring stall, which she has been operating for the last five years. She generates a monthly income of KES 7,500. 

She has applied for her second loan  from VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to purchase more stock of clothes for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to expand the current business.Her dream is to expand her business and educate their children.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for sale.

loans.name: Akwany

texts.en:
Akwany is a 71 year-old from Siaya region which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is married and supports 2 people in his family. He has one child who is 18 years old.

Akwany makes bricks,  a business he has been doing for the last 6 years generating a monthly income of KES 5,000. He has applied for his first loan with Vision Fund Kenya, which he will use to purchase materials for making bricks like firewood and water and to pay laborers. Akwany will use the anticipated profits to plow back into the business.

His dream is to have a successful life.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for making bricks.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.en:
Gulshan is a 60-year-old active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan with her four children. One of her sons is a mechanic by profession and he has been doing this business for many years. He is responsible for managing the entire household.

Gulshan's son needs to buy different types of tools and other accessories for the purpose of his business, but due to insufficient financial resources he is unable to buy these tools and accessories. Therefore, Gulshan has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan amount her son can easily purchase the relevant merchandise to fulfill his business needs and earn a more profitable income.

For this financial support, Gulshan is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To buy different types of tools and other accessories to fulfill her son's business needs

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Maria de 31 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa alquilada con su hijo, ella posee una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace varios años, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra sacar adelante a su hijo y los gastos del hogar, Maria esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas productos como: sopas, granos basicos, refrescos, golosinas, verduras, etc. y asi obtener mejores ingresos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a 31-year-old single mother who lives in a rented house with her son. She has a small store in her home that she has managed for several years. Through the sales she generates, Maria is able to help her son get ahead and to pay for the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan in order to buy more products such as soups, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, vegetables, and other items. This will help her generate more income and provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy soups, basic grains, soft drinks, snack foods, vegetables, and other products.

loans.name: Estela Margarita

texts.es: Estela tiene 27 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 7 y 9 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando en la escuela pública de su localidad. Estela se gana la vida por medio de la venta de variedad de ropa como: faldas, vestidos, blusas,etc. Tiene mucho tiempo de dedicarse a este negocio por lo que ya cuenta con muchos clientes que cada día la prefieren más. Estela solicita este crédito a FUSAI dado desea reparar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo que necesita materiales como: lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para reparar el techo y las paredes de la vivienda.
texts.en: Estela is 27-years old and lives in her own home with her husband and their two children, who are 7 and 9 years old respectively.  The children go to the public school in their area.  Estela earns her living selling a variety of clothing like skirts, dresses, blouses etc.  She has earned her living in this business for a long time, and as such already has a lot of customers who prefer her more each day.  Estela is requesting a loan from FUSAI because she wants to repair the conditions of her dwelling.  She needs materials such as galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair the roof and walls of her home.

loans.use: to purchase galvanized sheet metal, wood and nails to repair her home's roof and walls.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is 40 years old and supports a family of five. He runs a retail shop in Kapsabet office. This has been his income generating business for the last seven years. He gets an average monthly income of KES 20,000. 

He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 65,000 to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. He will use the profits from the retail shop business to pay his children’s school fees. His dream is to become stable in his life.

loans.use: To purchase household goods and foodstuffs for  sale in his shop.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is married with four children, two of whom go to school. She has a business selling green bananas and has been in this business for 10 years.

She has applied for a loan of 900,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bunches of green bananas. She works at the market seven days out of every week and sells on a retail basis. Her major business challenges include thieves and transportation. She aspires to owning a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to become a wholesaler. She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of timely loans.

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of green bananas

loans.name: Nyasura Group

texts.en:
Ester is a mother of two daughters who are enrolled in school. She is in her mid 30s and married. Ester is a businesswoman who has made a living for her family by running a beauty salon for 3.5 years. She works at her business from 7 am until 8 pm each working day and is able to make a small profit each month. 

This will be Ester’s first loan through Tujijenge Tanzania. She is applying for a loan to be apportioned among Nyasura, her six-member group. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
 
Ester will use her portion of this loan to buy more salon hair products. Her ambition is to greatly improve her business and open a beauty salon training center.

loans.use: to buy more salon hair products .

loans.name: Then

texts.en:
Then, 35 years old, is a teacher in Wat Teb Primary School which is located in Kampong Spue Province. His wife is a factory worker in Winson Factory. This couple is able to earn USD 7 a day to support their two children. For a comfortable lifestyle, Then wishes to have clean energy to use in his house.

Because of lacking capital, he is asking for a loan in the sum of USD 1,000 to build a biogas digester, under the project of NBP (National Biogas Program) in partnering with HKL. After an initial investment in this system, he hopes that he won’t spend much money on fuel and will lessen the smoke from wood or charcoal. Last but not least, he is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than the usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a biogas digester

loans.name: Philister

texts.en:
Philister is 52 years old, married to Michael and they are blessed with three children aged between 29 and 20 years old. She has been in the shop and dry maize business for the last twenty-one years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000. 

She is served by Visionfund's Kapsabet office where she has currently borrowed KES 73,000 and plans to use the whole amount of the loan to pay school fees. She will use the profits from the maize and shop trade to pay her children's fees.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her son in university.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
She is 28 years old, married and blessed with three boys and one girl aged between 12 and five years old. She has been in business for four years earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She has borrowed a loan to buy more stock for her kiosk.

With the anticipated profits she gets, she will pay school fees. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be a wholesaler and have her family run smoothly financially.

loans.use: to buy general goods

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is still actively involved in crop farming and her speciality has remained vegetables, such as cabbages and spinach, tomatoes and onions. She is now 25 years old, still married and happily taking care of her three children. Her income has currently increased and it is now 15,000/- and she is happy with the business as she was able to open a retail shop business which provides secondary business.

She has applied for her second loan to be able to add soft drinks in her retail shop and also pay for labour in her farm as well as add fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides.

She would like to expand and become a landlady by building rental houses for tenants to rent.

loans.use: to buy stock for the shop and pay for labour

loans.name: Ian

texts.en:
Ian is 27 years old. He is single although he supports his sister. He has been running his sales and repair of ICT business for the last four years now. 

He has applied for a loan of KES 30,000 to expand his business by buying computers and accessories to sell to clients in his area. He currently makes an estimated monthly income of KES 25,000. He has successfully paid his previous loans.

In the future, he hopes and dreams of becoming a supplier of computers and electronics.

loans.use: to buy computers and accessories to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 41 years old and married. She and her spouse have been blessed with three children. She has an internet cafe business, which she has been running for five years. She also sells stationery items and provides office services, such as photocopying and typing. Her husband also provide additional income.

Her estimated monthly income is KES 15,000. She will be using this loan to pay for her children's school fees.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya, and in future she hopes to expand her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 29 years old and married to Lydia. He supports two people in his family. 

He runs a cattle trading business in Kabirirsang trading centre in Nandi County. He has been in this business for the last twelve years and he gets an average monthly income of KES 25,000. 

He plans to use the amount borrowed of KES 50,000 to purchase more cows for resale. He will use the profits from the business to sustain himself and his dependents.

loans.use: to purchase more cows for sale.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en: Salim is a forty-five year old male living in Masindi-Uganda. He deals in retail business in a rural area, motorcycle transportation for additional income and also owns a school. Salim started his business so as to earn an income and to maintain his family's standards of living. Salim wishes to improve on his school by adding more classes. However he faces a challenge of competition and inadequate capital. Salim will use the loan to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap and biscuits to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, soap and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to commercialize.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 38 years old and married with four children. She has been in retail shop as a primary business and also does farming as a secodanry business for more than 15 years now. Her monthly income is 8,000 KES.

Grace has borrowed her first loan to purchase more stock like washing detergents,sugar,packets of sweets for sale in her shop and also buy pesticides for her farming activity.

Grace will use the anticipated profit to enlarge her business. This is her first loan with VisionFund Kenya. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to become economically fit and to live without struggling in her old age.

loans.use: to buy  washing detergents,sugar,packets of sweets for sale in her shop and also buy pesticides

loans.name: Hoang

texts.en:
Hoang is 58 years old and is widowed with five  children. She has been running a store selling religious items for 20 years. She started this business to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Hoang is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of religious items to sell from her store. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy religious items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jozeph

texts.en:
Jozeph is a 24-year-old married man with two children living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. 

He operates a furniture workshop where he has spent four years selling home use furniture. This has helped him to earn income that he has used to educate his children. He has always reaped tangible benefits and he also used these profits to improve his welfare and that of the family. 

His plan is to grow his business. He is requesting a loan to buy timber for using to make furniture for selling.

loans.use: to buy timber for using to make furniture for selling.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is 52 years old and is married with two children. She has been running a food stall selling candies and processing hammock parts in front of her door for 20 years. She started these businesses to cover her expenses and raise her children. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Giau is requesting a loan to buy a large stock of candies to sell from her stall so that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest to her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy candies for resale

loans.name: Chinh

texts.en: Chinh would like to take a further loan to buy a larger quantity of rubber materials to make shoes to sell from her store. Chinh's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in further increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy rubber materials to increase her production of shoes.

loans.name: Dao

texts.en: Dao would like to take a further loan to buy a greater quantity of green beans to make bean sprouts to sell from her stall. Dao's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of green beans to make bean sprouts

loans.name: Hai

texts.en:
Hai, 32, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with her family, including a son and her husband. Hai and her husband earn money through their business selling vegetables. She started this business six years ago. 

Hai would  like to get a loan to buy a larger quantity of vegetables to meet her customers' needs. She hopes her business will ensure that her family members, and especially her child, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy a larger quantity of vegetables for selling from her store.

loans.name: Lan

texts.en: Lan is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in expanding the size of her store and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety of products, in particular foods and beverages, to stock her store

loans.name: Tripati Swamy Group

texts.en:
Ananta is the leader of a group that hails from Muniguda in Rayagada district of Odisha, India. She is a married woman of 44 years. She has a small family comprised of three members: herself, her husband, and one son aged 24. The member standing second from left with raised hand is Ananta. 

Ananta has had a dried fish business for the last 12 years. She is wholesaling the dried fish to retailers. Her husband is supporting her for the smooth running of the business. The family income is about Rs.9,000 per month.

Having been through tremendous trials and tribulations herself, Ananta, along with another four members of her locality, formed a group to access loans and improve their businesses. It is the first loan for development of their existing businesses.  

Ananta wants to take a loan to purchase dried fish from Andhra Pradesh for wholesaling. She has a cherished desire to have Pacca (brick-built) house of her own.

The other four members have a fish business, a hotel, a fancy store and a mobile and accessories store.

loans.use: to purchase a big quantity of dried fish from Andhra Pradesh for wholesaling

loans.name: Safina

texts.en:
Safina  is a single mother of six children and all her children attend school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  

She sells fish and has been in this business 10 years.  She has applied for  800,000 UGX from MCDT-SACCO to buy baskets of fish. She works at the market seven days each week and sells on retail basis.  Her major business challenges include the changing seasons and price increases of fish and transportation. 

She aspires to become a wholesaler, buy land, and build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and running water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: to buy more baskets of fish.

loans.name: Yan

texts.en:
From a rural area of Svay Antor District, Kampong Cham Province, Yan is a 55-year-old married woman and an experienced farmer who grows rice on her own farmland. Having been in this business for more than 40 years, she can generate an income of USD 7.00 per day. 

Yan has taken a loan of KHR 4,000,000 to build a latrine for her household use. She will buy the construction materials needed and pay for labor costs. This will enable her to build a healthy family and protect her family members from unexpected illness. She is grateful for the loan granted through HKL, which has a much lower interest rate than is usual for this kind of loan product.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Begam

texts.ru: Эту 63-летнюю пожилую жительницу района Хуросон зовут Бегам. Она жена, мать и бабушка. Бегам на старости лет занимается животноводством. Она начала эту деятельность 7 лет назад. Ей помогают муж-пенсионер и сыновья. С их помощью она выращивает бычков в течение месяца и затем продает по прибыльной цене. Бегам сейчас хочет увеличить поголовье скота, чтобы продвинуть бизнес. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит и надеется, что ей окажут поддержку.
texts.en: This 63-year-old senior is a resident of the Khuroson District. Her name is Begam. She is a wife, mother and grandmother. Begam took up livestock breeding late in life. She began this business seven years ago. Her retired husband and sons help her with this business. With their help, she raising bull calves over the course of a month and then sells them at a profit. Begam now wants to increase the size of her herd in order to advance her business. She is requesting a loan for this purpose and hopes that you will show her support.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 40-year-old lady from Kisumu County, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Jacton who also supports the family by providing income and they have two children who are 10 and 27 years old respectively.
She has a retail shop which has been operating for the last five years and generates a monthly income of KES 20,000 for the family. She has applied for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to purchase sugar, maize flour and cooking oil to boost her stock.
She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business. Her dream is to live better and support the needy.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 36-year-old mother from Kisumu region, which is located in the western part of Kenya. She is married to Barack who is a businessman and supports the family by providing an income. She supports three people in their family and has two children who are six and four years old, respectively.

She has a kiosk where she sells groceries. She has been operating this kiosk for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 8,000. She is taking her third loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy assorted cereals. She will use the anticipated profit to expand her business.

Her dream is to expand her business and support the family.

loans.use: to buy assorted cereals for sale.

loans.name: Irine

texts.en:
Irine is 48 years old, married and supports a family of six. She runs a retail shop which gives her a monthly income  of Kenya shillings 12,000 and this has been in operation for the last fifteen years.

She plans to use the amount borrowed of 50,000 KES to purchase maize flour, sugar, rice and cooking fat for resale. She will use the profits from the retail shop business to pay her children’s school fees and to sustain her business. Her future plans are to open other business shops in the town.

loans.use: to buy goods for sale in the shop

loans.name: Teodulo

texts.en:
Teodulo has been operating his motorcycle transportation services for more than eight years, earning well for the family. He was able to cover the expenses of his daughter's education and successfully repaid his previous loan used for spare parts and tires. To improve the service, he took a new loan to  purchase motorcycle  accessories like raincoats to serve his customers better.

Teodulo plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to purchase another motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle accessories like raincoats to serve his customers better

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 38 year-old-lady from Mamboleo junction, in Kisumu county. She is married and supports three people in her family. She has three children, aged  19, 16 and 10 years. 

She sells fish, a business she has been doing for the past six years. She generates a monthly income of KES 15,000. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to expand her business by buying more stock of fish for sale. She will plow back the anticipated profit into the business.

Her dream is to expand her business and educate her children to become responsible people in the society.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Jerry James

texts.en: Jerry James has operated a transportation service for more than twelve years. He earns well from this business that sustains and provides for the needs of his family. From his income, his previous loan, used for buying spare parts, was repaid successfully. His business runs smoothly and he has saved a portion of his revenue for the future needs of his family. To cover the costs  for repair of his existing jeepney, he took a new loan recently.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living situation of his family.

loans.use: to cover the costs  for repair of his existing jeepney

loans.name: Kinyayobyo Rural Farmers Group

texts.en:
Stephen is a 38-year-old married male with six children, four of whom attend school. Stephen is a farmer dealing in crop production in a rural area.  He began the business to improve his family's livelihood. Stephen wants money to buy pesticides, fertilizers and to pay for labour. He is a hardworking and honest man; however, the many changes in the weather affect his productivity. Stephen is a member of Kinyayobyo Rural Farmers where each member guarantees the other to get a loan since they don't pledge security.
It is a group policy to guarantee one another whether you are taking a loan or not.This explains why there is an extra person.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers and pay for labour.

loans.name: Rwensenene Kweterana Group

texts.en:
Catherine, a member of Rwensenene Kweterane group, is a hard-working lady living in Fort Portal Uganda.  

She is a farmer and deals in selling second-hand clothes for supplementary income. She faces hardships of unpredictable weather changes and inadequate capital. Besides that, she dreams of educating her children to higher levels of learning. 

Catherine needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nsuura 1 Savings And Credit Group

texts.en: Alfred used his previous loan to buy more stocks of produce to sell. His main business is selling fresh food and produce, and he also works as a farmer in order to boost his income. The main challenges that Alfred faces are price fluctuations, and low demand for his products. Despite these issues, Alfred has a vision of expanding his business and educating his children. Alfred has asked for a loan to add stock of banana, Irish potatoes and vegetables for sell. He is a member of this group where each member holds each other accountable for loan repayments.

loans.use: to add stock of banana, irish potatoes and vegetables for sell.

loans.name: Simplisio

texts.en:
Simplisio is a 39-year-old married father of two children, both attending school. Simplisio has been farming for 10 years, and also has an electronic supplies business to boost his income. He started the businesses to support his family. His major challenge is the difficulties posed by climate change.

Simplisio is requesting this loan to pay for farm labour. His dream is to build his own house.

loans.use: To pay for farm labour.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius is a 54-year-old married man with ten children, six of whom attend school. Julius operates a retail shop and works six days a week, six hours a day, He has been in business for fourteen years and used a previous loan to buy clothes for resale. 

Julius began the business to cater to his family. Educating his children to university is his dream, although price fluctuations are a challenge he encounters. 

Julius has asked for a loan to buy rice, salt, millet flour, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy rice, salt, millet flour, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Phaebe

texts.en:
Phaebe is a 35-year-old single female with five children, four of whom go to school. She used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. She maintains her dream of providing for her family by educating her children and building a house for them, although she is affected by bad debts and high rental costs. 

Phaebe is requesting for a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 33-year-old married male with four children; two are going to school. Francis has a tailoring business on a busy street and works 12 hours a day; he began the business to generate income. Francis dreams of buying land and building a commercial house. 

Francis wants money to buy materials for school uniforms and men's and women's suits. Francis is a hardworking man, though he is faced with a challenge of inadequate capital.

loans.use: To buy materials for school uniforms and men's and women's suits.

loans.name: Kansenene Group

texts.en: John, who is still a member of Kansenene United group, used the previous loan to purchase fresh produce for sale. He has continued with the same business of selling fresh foods alongside retail in order to boost his income. He faces challenges of high transport expenses and rent. Besides that, he has hopes of educating his children to higher levels of learning. John needs a loan to add more stock of retail goods for sale.

loans.use: to add more stock of retail goods for sale

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius, aged 49, lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with four children aged between 12 and 4 years and all attend school. He runs a motorcycle transport business and gets additional income from a retail shop. He started business so as to generate income to educate his children and improve their standard of living.

Julius desires to buy more motorcycles to increase his income. He faces the difficulty of poor roads. He is acquiring credit to buy general merchandise like sugar,rice and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise like sugar, rice and soap to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a widow and has four children who are adults. They live in their own house that has piped water but no electricity. 

Fatuma has operated a barber shop business, and her customers are men and school kids. She works hard to ensure her family lives well, as she is the bread winner.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase a shaving machine for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a shaving machine for her business

loans.name: Loan's Group

texts.en:
Loan is 49 years old and lives with her sons and her husband. For the past five years, Loan has been running a business from her house taking care of children to earn an income to support her family. Loan takes care of children while their parents are working. She is the group leader of an eight-member loan group of men and women who live in Ho Chi Minh City. 

In the picture, she is in the fourth person from the left wearing a white blouse. Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Loan is requesting a loan to repair her childcare room and the bathroom of her house that she uses for taking care of children. She hopes that through her loan she will be able to provide better conditions for the children and offer a better service to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to repair the rooms of her house that she uses for her childcare business to provide better conditions for the children

loans.name: Duyen

texts.en: Duyen would like to take another loan to buy noodles and high quality spices to make food to sell from her stall. Duyen's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy noodles and high quality spices to make food to sell from her stall.

loans.name: Pedro Alonso

texts.es:
Pedro de 56 años de edad, no estudio ningún grado escolar, debido a que sus padres no tenían dinero para enviarlo a estudiar. Esta casado y su esposa le ayuda a trabajar en la agricultura, todos sus hijos ya están casados,  por lo que solo su esposa depende de él.


Pedro trabaja en la agricultura y lo ha hecho desde que era un niño, trabajo que aprendió de sus padres, se traslada 2 kilómetros en vehículo para llegar hasta donde tiene su parcela de maíz, lo ayuda uno de sus hijos aproximadamente sale de su trabajo a las 3:00 pm.


El préstamo que esta solicitando en CREDICAMPO, es para comprar semilla de maíz, fertilizantes, herbicidas, pesticidas para empezar a cultivar. 


Los sueños de Pedro es tener una vivienda mejor que la que tiene, confiá en Dios y su esfuerzo para que todo le sea posible.
texts.en:
Pedro is 56-years old.  He never went to school as his parents did not have the money to send him.  Pedro is married, and his wife helps him with his agricultural work.  All of his children are married, and so only his wife is dependent on him.  

Pedro works in agriculture and has done so since he was a boy.  He learned the work from his parents.  Pedro travels 2 kilometers by car to get to his parcel of land where the corn is planted.  One of his sons helps him in his work.  Pedro works until approximately 3:00 pm.

The loan Pedro is requesting from CREDICAMPO is to purchase corn seed, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides so he can start planting. 

Pedro's dream is to have a house that is better than the one he has now.  He trusts in God and his hard work that everything will be possible.

loans.use: to purchase corn seed, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to start planting.

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson is an old client at the institution who has applied for a loan of UGX 4,000,000. He lives in Nyakuju Bugyera – Rukungiri District. He is married and has four children.

The purpose of the loan is to restock his animal farm of cows so that he can raise more money to construct a house for his family. Dickson has been in this business for the last four seven years and has managed to raise money to meet his family's needs, including tuition for his children, and also to develop himself as a person.

Dickson's aspiration is to have first-class exotic cows from which he can get more milk to boost his income. His major challenges have been the increased costs of annual drugs, a shortage of labor to work on the farm, and changes in weather leading to a shortage of water and pasture. Dickson is hopeful that this loan will improve the situation at hand.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a 53-year-old widow, with six children, all of whom go to school. She’s a second-time borrower with UGAFODE Microfinance Limited, having taken a loan of UGX 2,000,000 and successfully paying it off. 

Betty is a resident of a rural area -Lubowa and wants a loan of UGX 5,000,000 to complete payment for a small vehicle to use in the driving school opened by her elder son, who completed vocational school and failed to find a job. She hopes this will help her son to earn some income and this will reduce the over-dependency on her. 

Betty is a poultry farmer and also is a voluntary worker at the Uganda Widow Association. She’s so grateful for the support extended to them as low income earners, especially widows that intend to better the lives of their families. 

Her future plan is to buy a plot of land and build a home for her family, educate her children, and also take adequate care of them. 

In the photo is Betty, with her son, and the car they intend to pay for.

loans.use: to buy a car for her son's driving school.

loans.name: Iringa Group

texts.en:
Abeli is a teen of early twenties and is living in one of the biggest cities in Tanzania. He has been employed as a music producer and DJ to one of the clubs in town for three years now. His wages are not good and do not enable him to meet all of his welfare costs, together with supporting his parents. He is so good in music production and DJ plays as his street tells. Seed capital is the challenge hindering Abeli to start his own business, but he believes through Kiva his dream of managing his own music firm will be possible. Abeli, together with his ten-member group, are joining together to request a loan for support. He works at his job from 8 am to midnight daily. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is the new group and Abeli's first loan which he will use to open his own editing business (music and film editing firm). He will share this loan with his loan group "Iringa", which consists of ten members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open his own editing business (music and film editing firm).

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 47-year-old lady from Katito region in Kisumu county, within the western part of Kenya. She supports two people in her family. She has three children who are 16, 13 and seven years old.

She sells charcoal, a business she has been doing for the last three years. She generates a monthly income of 10,000 KES. She is taking her second loan with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to increase her working capital by buying more stock of charcoal for sale. 


She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of chacoal

loans.name: Kigoma Group

texts.en:
Hamis, a father of three schooling children, is in his early thirties. He is married and supports his family by running a beauty salon, general store and an M-pesa business. He has run the businesses for five years now. His businesses are open from 8:00 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. per working day, and he is able to make a good profit each month. 

Hamis is requesting a first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy salon hair products and shop missing products;rice,maize and baking flour,soda, take away juices etc. 

He will share this loan with his loan group, "Kigoma", which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

Hamis dreams of building a nice family house.

loans.use: to buy salon hair products and shop missing products;rice,maize flour,soda, take away juices etc.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en: Evans is a 34-year-old married man. He has one child. He describes himself as honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft and insecurity. He will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Micro finance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow for his family.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Asenath

texts.en:
Asenath is a 35-year-old lady from Kisumu town which is found in Nyanza province in western part of Kenya. She is married and supports three people in her family. She has three children aged 11, 10, and six years old. 

She has a retail shop which has been operating for the last three years and generates a monthly income of KES 25,000. She has applied for a second loan with VisionFund Kenya Ltd which she will use to pay school fees for her children in school. This will enable her to be able to grow her business so that she can repay this loan slowly and her children do not suffer and stay home.

Her dream is to have a big business and support the family.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 36 years old. He is married and has been blessed with one child. He has been collecting garbage in his area for 10 years now and makes an estimated monthly income of KES 80,000. This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya and he successfully repaid his previous loan.

He would like a loan of KES.30,000 through which he will buy polythene bags to supply to clients for garbage collection. He dreams of opening a garbage collection limited company.

loans.use: to buy polythene bags for garbage collection.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy commodities (t-shirts, sweaters, pants, and jackets, among others)

loans.name: Jhonnatan Jeener

texts.es:
Jhonnatan es un joven de 22 años de edad, soltero, vive en Chiclayo junto a su familia.
Estudió la carrera de Computación en un Instituto de la zona donde reside y desde hace 2 años ejerce su profesión como Técnico en Computación en una prestigiosa empresa.
Es una persona con muchas ganas de salir adelante y mejorar su nivel de vida y el de su familia, es por ello que cada día trabaja incansablemente para darles un futuro mejor.
Jhonnatan está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado él podrá comprar algunos electrodomésticos como cocina y refrigeradora para amueblar su vivienda y así puedan sentir mayor comodidad y que sus alimentos sean más duraderos. Con esta tranquilidad podrá ir a trabajar sin preocupaciones y poco a poco podrá cumplir su más grande sueño: "Tener su propio negocio".
texts.en:
Jhonnatan is a 22-year-old young man. He is single and he lives with his family in Chiclayo. He studied computation in an institute near the neighborhood where he lives and he has worked as a computer technician in a prestigious business for two years.He is a person who wishes to get ahead and improve his quality-of-life and that of his family, so he works tirelessly every day to give them a better future. 

Jhonnatan is very thankful with the Kiva investors because their support has enabled him to buy some electrical appliances like a stove and a refrigerator to furnish his home and make his family feel more comfortable. Their food also lasts longer. He will now be able to go to work without worrying and little-by-little attain his goal of having his own business.

loans.use: to buy electrical appliances (stove and refrigerator)

loans.name: Robina

texts.en:
Robina is a 27-year-old married female with one child who does not go to school. She has owned a textile business on a busy street for three years now and has a pharmacy as an additional income source. Robina began the business to have better standards of living. 

Robina wants money to buy dresses, suits, trousers and shirts for selling. Robina is hardworking, even if she complains of high rental and license fees.

loans.use: To buy dresses, suits, trousers and shirts for selling.

loans.name: Pedro Carlos

texts.es:
Pedro está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que es la segunda vez que le brindan su gran apoyo y en esta oportunidad podrá comprar una refrigeradora para su hogar, de esta manera podrá conservar los alimentos en buenas condiciones y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Día a día Pedro trabaja como chofer de taxi, al igual que muchas personas en el país, el trabaja en este tipo de negocio ya que es el único medio en el cual puede solventar a su familia y con él puede salir adelante, el trabaja alrededor de 10 horas al día y puede atender hasta 40 clientes en el día; él cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable con los clientes y sobre todo porque es muy carismático con los clientes, y con este humilde empleo puede sacar adelante a su familia .
texts.en:
Pedro is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  This is the second time that they are providing him with their great support.  This time he will be able to buy a refrigerator for his home.  This way he will be able to keep the food from spoiling and improve his quality of life.

Pedro works day to day as a taxi driver.  Like many people in the country, he works in this type of business because it is the only way he is able to support his family.  With this work he is able to get ahead.  He works around ten hours a day, and he is able to tend to up to 40 customers a day.  He believes that it is going well in his business because he is very friendly with the customers.  Most of all, it is going well because he is very charismatic with the customers.  With this humble job he is able to get his family ahead.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator.

loans.name: Zalimon

texts.en:
Zalimon is a  35-year-old married man with three children; two attend school. Being a teacher professionally, he works 8 hours a day and has been in service for ten years. 

Zalimon joined the teaching profession because he had no option due to lack of money to take him to university. Zalimon wants money to buy building materials like bricks and timber for construction. Zalimon is hard-working in spite of his low salary.

The primary sector and activity were chosen basing on what the client is going to use the loan for but not the profession.

loans.use: to buy building materials like bricks and timber for construction.

loans.name: Nickson

texts.en:
This is Nickson, a repeat client aged 33 years. He is a married man and has three children. He lives in a village in Kyamate, Ntungamo.
He applied for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. He is using it to hire labourers, who will plough land, thus expanding the cultivated land for planting tomatoes and bananas. He thought that, if he could engage in agriculture more extensively, he could increase the income for the family, and possibly educate his children in better schools. He wants this because he, himself, did not go to school. He is hard-working, and determined to do all it takes to give his children a better future, through education.

loans.use: To hire labourers for ploughing more land

loans.name: Zubairi

texts.en:
Zubairi is a father of six and lives in Hoima, Uganda. Five of his children attend school. He sells sugar, salt, soap, and other general merchandise alongside his businesses of cattle fattening and farming.

He started business his in 2000 and works seven days a week. He hopes to educate his children and buy them enough land. Load shedding hinders his business. He is acquiring a loan to buy more maize and beans to sell. He is acquiring a loan to buy new solar panels for lighting.

loans.use: to buy  new solar panels for lighting.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a married woman who is 55 years of age and lives in a rural area with her family of nine children.  Among her children, four attend school from different directions. She deals in farming/piggery where she grows crops like maize, bananas, coffee, and beans. She needs the loan to buy piglets. She identified them at a cheaper than usual price and would like to seize the opportunity since she believes the returns will be high.  She has an additional income from a tailoring business. She started this business in 1998.

She works 7 hours per day and she acquired this loan for school fees and to buy more food for pigs and the piglets.  She has hopes of expanding into a large business which can supply all the people around and educate her children. Her clients are traders from her village and the surrounding places.

The challenges she faces are price fluctuation in market places.  She is hard-working.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Rana 26 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rana 26. It consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They know each other through friendship and being neighbors. The group asked for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Jamala is a 43-year-old married woman with four children. Her oldest child is ten years old and the youngest one is two years old. She lives with her family in miserable conditions in Taiz, Yemen. She is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. She lives in a very old house. This house needs repair and maintenance. She wants to make it more spacious and comfortable, but she doesn't have enough money to do that. As a result, Jamala is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use the loan to purchase construction materials in order to repair her house.

Jamala's dream in the future is completing the renovation of her whole house. She plans to open a savings account with AMB, and she hopes to send her children to private schools.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials in order to repair her house.

loans.name: Karugutu Orphans Group

texts.en:
Lukia, whose hand is raised in the group photo, is a 54-year-old, widowed woman. She has four children and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She deals in cassava-flour-selling and has been in practice since 1980. She sells to the people around her. Low capital, and competition to invest in a larger cassava-selling business, affect her.She wishes to construct a good residential house for her children, one day. Lukia is  for a loan to buy cassava, for grinding into flour to sell.
The extra person in the group is also a group member but didn't take a loan and in accordance to the group policy, whether one is taking a loan or not,you have to guarantee your fellow group members.

loans.use: to buy cassava, for grinding into flour to sell.

loans.name: Dúo La Arboleda Group

texts.es:
DUO LA ARBOLEDA
El Señor Alejandro de 65 años, casado. Desde hace 2 años posee una Crianza de Marranos ubicada en Los Aposentos Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio él ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de Don Alejandro es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Maíz, concentrado y lechones  para seguir creciendo con su Crianza de Marranos.
texts.en:
DUO LA ARBOLEDA (Duo The Woods)

Alejandro, 65 years of age, is married. For two years he has owned a pig breeding farm located in Los Aposentos, Chimaltenango. Through his efforts he managed to establish the farm and improve his home. Through his business he has been able to support his family and get them ahead.

Alejandro's dream is to be able to improve the quality of life for himself and his family through the loan which he is requesting from  FAPE. With the loan he wants to buy corn, animal feed and suckling pigs in order to keep growing his pig breeding farm.

loans.use: to buy pigs and their feed

loans.name: Marleny Isabel

texts.es:
La  joven Marleny es una persona responsable, emprendedora  y  trabajadora vive en una comunidad al sur de Honduras junto a su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Su negocio es la elaboración de  comales desde hace 2 años, los cuales vende en su comunidad  y  a personas aledañas a ella. En su negocio ella recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y esposo esto ayudado a tener una mejor atención a sus clientes.
Marleny Necesita el préstamo para comprar lamina hacer sus comales para surtir su negocio. Ya que tiene bastantes clientes y la mercadería que tiene no satisfacen las demandas, así planea también aumentar sus nivel de  ventas para poder ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y tener una mejor calidad de vida.

Choluteca, Honduras – Mayo del  2014
texts.en:
Marleny is a responsible, entrepreneurial and hardworking young woman. She lives in a community in the south of Honduras with her husband and their two children. Her business, as of two years ago, is the preparation of hot plates, which she sells in her town and to people neighboring her. In her business, she receives help from her children and husband, this helping to give better attention to her customers. 

Marleny needs the loan to buy metal plates to make her hot plates to supply her business. Since she has many customers and the supply that she has does not satisfy the demand, this way she also is planning to increase her level of sales in order to help her children with their studies and to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy metal plates in order to make hot plates for her business.

loans.name: Horacio

texts.es:
Horacio esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que con su ayuda el podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes y dar mantenimiento a su cultivo de cacao, de esta manera podrá tener una buena cosecha y sus ingresos podrán mejorar, de esta manera podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y seguir trabajando como agricultor ya que actualmente también se ha sembrado maíz.

Horacio seguirá trabajando con mucho empeño y dedicación, sobre todo porque la agricultura es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante y luchar por hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener una mejor vivienda y poder darle una buena educación a sus hijos”.
texts.en:
Horacio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because with their help he will be able to buy manure and fertilisers and maintain his cocoa crop. In this way, he can achieve a good harvest and improve his income and so improve the quality of life for his family. He will also be able to continue working as a farmer, as he has now also sown some maize.

Horacio will continue working with a lot of with determination and dedication, especially since agriculture is his only source of income. Doing this, he can get on and fight to achieve his great dream: having a better house and being able to give his children a good education.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilisers and to maintain his cocoa crop.

loans.name: Celestian

texts.en:
Celestian is a single mother of one child of who attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and fees for her kid

For the past three years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 30,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Сабохат жизнерадостная и молодая женщина. Сабохат замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 8, 5 и 3 года. Ее муж Умедчон предприниматель. Сабохат более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги швеи. Она шьёт национальные женские платья. Сабохат предоставляет свои услуги у себя дома. Она постепенно развевает свой бизнес. Сабохат хочет купить вышивальную машинку и таким образом она хочет расширить сферу услуги и таким образом привлечь больше клиентов. Сабохат запрашивает займ на сумму 3500 сомони для покупки вышивальной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и преждевременно благодарит вас.
texts.en: Sabohat is a cheerful young woman. Sabohat is married and is raising three children. Her children are 8, 5, and 3 years old. Her husband Umedjon is an entrepreneur. For more than 5 years, Sabohat has been offering her services as a seamstress. She sews ethnic Tajik women's dresses. Sabohat offers her services out of her house. She is gradually developing her business. Sabohat wants to buy an embroidery machine as she wants to expand her offered services and attract more customers. Sabohat is requesting a loan in the amount of 3500 somoni to buy an embroidery machine. She awaits your kindness and thanks you in advance.

loans.use: to buy an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Malek

texts.en: Malek is 24 years old. He lives with his family of seven members. Malek is a university student majoring in Class Teaching and he is in his last year. He is planning to find a good job in his study field after graduation so that he will be able to be a provider for his family and support them. Now he is seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees as he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Atanaziraba Women Group

texts.en:
Safina is a single woman, aged 50, with three children who are all attending school. She is also looking after two orphans. She lives in a rural area and carries out farming and animal rearing. She has been in farming for fifteen years and works five days a week and eight hours per day.

She started the business to develop and get tuition for her children, and acquired the loan to boost her agricultural business. He badly needs the loan to pay tuition for her children in secondary school. She will repay the loan using income from farming.

Her clients are residents and traders from different cities. She hopes to enlarge her business, though her challenge is too much drought, which affects both the crops and animals. 

She describes herself as a hardworking woman who encourages fellow women to be innovative.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: Rinad 26 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Rinad 26. It is comprised of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They are requesting a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.

Sameera is the leader of the group. She is a 45-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest child is 30 years old and the youngest one is 8 years old.  She lives with her family in their own house. Sameera works as a housewife and she is a very dynamic woman. Her husband is employed as a teacher in a private school. The salary that he receives from his job is good, but it is not enough to renovate their old house. Their house needs to be renovated from the inside. Most of the rooms are not renovated in addition to the kitchen and the bathroom. This negatively affects Sameera and she feels ashamed, especially if any guests or visitors come to her house. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase cement to renovate the house from the inside.

Sameera hopes to open her own business in order to help her husband with the expenses of the family. She plans to open a saving account with AMB.

loans.use: to purchase cement to renovate her house from the inside.
